5293c940-a006-4e04-bb76-12a0f2dcddc3
Slice the mangoes to remove the stones. Cut the mango meat into small squares without piercing the skin. Scoop out with a spoon directly into a bowl.
5293c940-a006-4e04-bb76-12a0f2dcddc3
Peel the cucumbers, scoop out and discard the seeds, then cut the cucumber flesh into cubes about the same size as the mangoes.
5293c940-a006-4e04-bb76-12a0f2dcddc3
Cut the mangoes into halves, scoop out and discard the seeds, then cut the flesh into small cubes (see notes after the recipe).
5293c940-a006-4e04-bb76-12a0f2dcddc3
Peel and roughly chop the onions.
5293c940-a006-4e04-bb76-12a0f2dcddc3
Add the cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, scallions and cilantro to the mango in the bowl. Toss gently.
5293c940-a006-4e04-bb76-12a0f2dcddc3
Stir together all the ingredients for the dressing until the no solids are visible.
5293c940-a006-4e04-bb76-12a0f2dcddc3
Drizzle half of the dressing over the contents of the bowl. Toss everything together. Taste. If under-dressed, drizzle in the remaining dressing and toss a few more times.
ea25e9b4-c9b3-43c5-a4f6-4ff6785a8f30
d9ceb399-13a9-49b2-86fe-6d566e5e854e
7227291b-62c0-4dfb-b547-ee2d076b5d16
Cut the chicken fried steaks into half-inch wide strips.
7227291b-62c0-4dfb-b547-ee2d076b5d16
Tear the lettuce into smaller pieces, rinse and pass through the salad spinner.
7227291b-62c0-4dfb-b547-ee2d076b5d16
Cut the tomatoes into wedges.
7227291b-62c0-4dfb-b547-ee2d076b5d16
Peel and thinly slice the onion.
7227291b-62c0-4dfb-b547-ee2d076b5d16
Place all the ingredients, including the peaches, croutons and fresh herbs, in a mixing bowl. Drizzle in three tablespoons chili lime salad dressing and toss.
7227291b-62c0-4dfb-b547-ee2d076b5d16
Ladle the salad into bowls. Serve with more chili lime dressing on the side.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
Cut the beef into thin slices.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
Rinse the lettuce and break up unto bite-size pieces. Pass through the salad spinner to remove as much water as possible.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
Dump the bean sprouts in a large bowl and fill with water. Pick out bean skins that float and discard. Pour off the water. Rinse the sprouts a few times and drain. Pass through the salad spinner (don’t overdo this!) to remove surface water.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
Toast the cashew nuts in an oil-free pan until lightly browned. Cool.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
To make the dressing, start by thinning the peanut butter. Place in a bowl, add a quarter cup of hot water and mix until smooth.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
Add the rest of the salad dressing ingredients to the peanut butter and mix well. Add more hot water, a tablespoon at a time, until the dressing is pourable. Note that I used a total of one-half cup hot water.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
In a large mixing bowl, toss the beef, lettuce and bean sprouts.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
Drizzle the dressing over the salad.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
Sprinkle in the cashew nuts.
6b2ae73e-8711-4438-80d4-f6e38902b51a
Serve the remaining dressing on the side.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the dressing Start by making the dressing to give the flavors time to develop. Peel the garlic, lightly pound then place in a small bowl and drizzle in just enough olive oil to moisten.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the dressing Heat an oil-free pan and roast the garlic over low heat until soft, lightly browned and aromatic. Cool.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the dressing Mash the cooled garlic on a plate with the back of a fork. Alternatively, use a mortar and pestle.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the dressing Place the mashed garlic in a bowl. Add the mayo and mix. Add a teaspoonful of lemon juice, a pinch of salt and a pinch of pepper. Taste. Add more lemon juice, salt and pepper to suit your taste. Cover the bowl and chill in the fridge.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the dressing (Note that the thickness of the dressing depends a lot on the quality of your mayo. If the dressing is still too thick after sufficient lemon juice has been added, do not be tempted to thin it out with more lemon juice. If you do, the dressing may turn out too tart. Thin out the dressing by adding milk or its vegan equivalent.)
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the salad Rest the burgers for 10 minutes after cooking. Cut into bite size pieces. Set aside.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the salad Rinse the lettuce well. Tear into bite size pieces then dry in a salad spinner.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the salad Cut the tomatoes into one-inch cubes.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the salad Split the cucumbers into halves lengthwise, scoop out and discard the seeds (skip the scooping part if you'd rather keep the seeds). Cut the cucumbers into one-inch cubes.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the salad On a platter, arrange all the salad ingredients in rows.
14084362-b941-451b-be7d-24a6cedbac47 Make the salad Drizzle the dressing over the burger salad and serve. Excess dressing may be served on the side.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Prep the salad components Thinly slice the mushrooms.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Prep the salad components Peel, halve and thinly slice the onion.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Prep the salad components Tear the lettuce into bite-size pieces, rinse thoroughly and dry in a salad spinner.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Saute the mushrooms Over medium heat, melt the two tablespoons butter in a large frying pan. Tilt the pan around to cover the entire bottom.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Saute the mushrooms Spread the mushrooms slices evenly in the pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Leave for about two minutes to allow the undersides to brown a little then cook, stirring often, for another two to three minutes until lightly browned.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Saute the mushrooms Scoop out the mushrooms and transfer to a bowl.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Make the dressing Peel and grate the garlic.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Make the dressing Add the garlic to the pan drippings and cook over medium-low heat for about 10 seconds.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Make the dressing Off the heat, add the rest of the butter. Swirl the pan until the butter is just melted.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Make the dressing Stir in the lemon juice.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Make the dressing Taste. Add more salt, pepper or lemon juice, or all of them.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Assemble the salad Pour two tablespoons of dressing into a mixing bowl. Tilt the bowl to allow the dressing to spread to the sides.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Assemble the salad Dump in the lettuce. Toss well.
c93aadc3-d977-4fab-8742-53bcfdea928a Assemble the salad Divide the lettuce among four salad bowls. Top with onion slices and the sauteed mushrooms. Drizzle in the remaining dressing. Serve at once.
eb1303d2-8b27-4adb-acb2-fb02bc2dcaed
Generously smear the bottom and sides of a mixing bowl with half of the dressing.
eb1303d2-8b27-4adb-acb2-fb02bc2dcaed
Throw in the lettuce, beef tongue, tomato wedges and onion slices.
eb1303d2-8b27-4adb-acb2-fb02bc2dcaed
Toss everything together lightly but thoroughly until everything is moistened. Toss, NOT mix.
eb1303d2-8b27-4adb-acb2-fb02bc2dcaed
If the salad looks like it needs more dressing, add the rest of the Caesar salad dressing and toss again. Still too dry? Add another tablespoon of dressing and toss once more.
eb1303d2-8b27-4adb-acb2-fb02bc2dcaed
Add the croutons and give the salad a few more tosses.
eb1303d2-8b27-4adb-acb2-fb02bc2dcaed
Taste the salad. Add salt or pepper, or both, if needed.
eb1303d2-8b27-4adb-acb2-fb02bc2dcaed
Serve the beef tongue salad with herbed croutons immediately.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Heat the olive oil in a small frying pan.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Cook the chickpeas in the hot oil until the surface is starting to brown.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Add the green beans. Cook, stirring often, for a minute.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Add the bell pepper and cook, stirring, for half a minute.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Stir in the tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Tip: if using a lot of feta, use salt sparingly. Stir once more and cook for another half a minute.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Tilt the contents of the frying pan into a salad bowl.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Spread the crumbled feta over the vegetables or crumble a piece of feta directly over them.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Sprinkle in the toasted cashew nuts.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Squeeze the lemon directly over everything making sure that no seeds fall into the bowl.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil over the salad.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Garnish with basil chiffonade.
46bfceb7-9cda-45d4-8d64-22f362bf7598
Serve the warm chickpea and green beans salad immediately.
3d53e043-b27c-4bce-abac-596eeb58a28a
Start by making the vinaigrette to allow the flavors to develop. Just place all the ingredients in a small jar with a screw-type cap, screw on the cap tightly and shake until the salt is fully dissolved.
3d53e043-b27c-4bce-abac-596eeb58a28a
Cut the grapes into halves.
3d53e043-b27c-4bce-abac-596eeb58a28a
Roughly chop the pecans.
3d53e043-b27c-4bce-abac-596eeb58a28a
Shred the cheese (I used the large holes of a box grater).
3d53e043-b27c-4bce-abac-596eeb58a28a
Finely slice the scallions.
3d53e043-b27c-4bce-abac-596eeb58a28a
Place all the salad ingredients in a bowl and toss lightly.
3d53e043-b27c-4bce-abac-596eeb58a28a
Drizzle in the vinaigrette and give a salad a few more tosses.
3d53e043-b27c-4bce-abac-596eeb58a28a
Serve the grapes and pecan salad immediately. Or, better still, cover the bowl and chill the salad for half an hour. Give the salad a final toss before serving.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
For instructions on how to precook the beef brisket, click here. Cut the cooled beef into half-inch slices. Set aside.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
In an oil-free pan, toast the cloves and fennel seeds until aromatic, about two minutes over medium heat. Grind to a powder.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
Heat the olive oil and sesame seed oil in a pan. Saute the half of the chilies, all the garlic, ginger, kaffir lime leaves and the ground cloves and fennel seeds.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
Pour in the soy sauce, mirin and about half a cup of water. Stir in the sugar, lemon zest and lemon juice. Taste and add salt and pepper, if needed.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
Bring the sauce to a simmer. Add the slices of beef brisket in one layer. Cook for a minute per side.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
To serve, arrange four to five beef slices on the middle of a plate. Pile kimchi rice on one side and salad on the opposite side. Sprinkle cashew nuts and some of the remaining chili slices over the beef. Serve at once.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
Tear the lettuce by hand (or cut with a knife) into bite size pieces. Rinse well. Dry in a salad spinner.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
Thinly slice the cucumber into rings (a mandoline is useful).
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
Peel and julienne the carrot.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
Separate the kani into thin strips.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
In a bowl, toss the lettuce, cucumber rings, julienned carrot and kani together lightly.
e477353b-c57f-46d9-b517-83c48d5aad29
Stir all the ingredients for the dressing. Drizzle over the salad and toss.
4748107e-5c23-4b02-9e2c-1efa381c6759 Make the dressing Start by mixing the dressing to give it time for the flavors to develop. Mix all the ingredients together but using only half of the toasted sesame seeds. Set aside.
4748107e-5c23-4b02-9e2c-1efa381c6759 Prepare the salad Thinly slice the cucumber and mango (peeling is optional) then cut into matchsticks.
4748107e-5c23-4b02-9e2c-1efa381c6759 Prepare the salad Cut open the mango, avoiding the stone at the middle. Make deep slashes about a quarter inch apart without piercing the skin. Using a spoon, scoop out shallowly to release the thin strips.
4748107e-5c23-4b02-9e2c-1efa381c6759 Toss the salad Place the cucumber, carrot and mango in a bowl. Using two forks (or the tips of your fingers), toss them lightly but thoroughly to distribute the colors evenly.
4748107e-5c23-4b02-9e2c-1efa381c6759 Toss the salad Drizzle in two tablespoons of dressing and toss. Taste. Add more dressing, as needed.
4748107e-5c23-4b02-9e2c-1efa381c6759 Toss the salad Sprinkle in the remaining toasted sesame seeds before serving the cucumber and mango salad with chili lime dressing.
6ed53620-b401-4d10-adc2-f6f3e799d93b
Rinse the spinach well to remove any trace of soil or sand. Do the same with the mung bean sprouts. Drain.
6ed53620-b401-4d10-adc2-f6f3e799d93b
Fill a medium sized pot with water. Bring to a rolling boil.
6ed53620-b401-4d10-adc2-f6f3e799d93b
Half fill two bowls with water and drop in a generous amount of ice.
6ed53620-b401-4d10-adc2-f6f3e799d93b
Drop the spinach into the boiling water, pushing down to submerge all of it. Cook for two minutes or just until wilted. Scoop out, with a kitchen spider, let the water drip off and plunge in the first bowl of icy water.
6ed53620-b401-4d10-adc2-f6f3e799d93b
Bring the water in the pot to boiling point once more. Drop in the mung bean sprouts and cook for half a minute. Scoop out, allow the excess water to drip off and plunge in the second bowl of icy water.
6ed53620-b401-4d10-adc2-f6f3e799d93b
Drain the spinach. Squeeze with your hands to remove as much water as you can. Roughly chop.
6ed53620-b401-4d10-adc2-f6f3e799d93b
Drain the mung bean sprouts.
6ed53620-b401-4d10-adc2-f6f3e799d93b
In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients for the dressing. Add the spinach and mung bean sprouts. Toss gently and serve.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Pat the chicken thigh fillets dry. Cut into 1 and 1/2-inch cubes.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
In a bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the chicken seasoning. Add the chicken cubes. Mix well. Cover the bowl and leave the chicken to marinate while you prepare the salad.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Rinse the Romaine lettuce. Tear into smaller pieces. Dump in the salad spinner and spin to dry.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Peel the kiwi fruits and mangoes, and cut into one-inch cubes.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Halve the cherry tomatoes.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Stir the cayenne powder into the Ranch dressing.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Toss the lettuce, kiwi, mangoes and cherry tomatoes with about a tablespoonful of the Ranch dressing.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Heat enough cooking oil in a wok or frying pan to reach a depth of two inches. The ideal temperature is 350F. If you don’t have a thermometer, dip a bamboo skewer in the oil; if tiny bubbles form around it, the oil should be hot enough.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Place the flour, egg whites and panko in three shallow bowls.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Dredge each piece of chicken in flour, roll in egg whites then coat with panko.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Fry the breaded chicken in batches of 10 to 15 (depending on how wide your frying pan is) until golden and crisp. Scoop out and drain on a rack.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Pile half of the mixed salad in a bowl. Scatter popcorn chicken over it. Cover with the rest of the salad and top with more popcorn chicken. Drizzle Ranch dressing over everything.
9eea84f2-af35-455d-998a-d48d7b463b37
Serve your popcorn chicken salad with spicy ranch dressing immediately.
d1b7a0b8-2437-45eb-901c-a298f132e8e9
Wipe the chicken thighs with paper towels. Rub with one teaspoon salt, a quarter teaspoon pepper and all of the cayenne powder. Place in a covered container and leave to marinate for at least two hours.
d1b7a0b8-2437-45eb-901c-a298f132e8e9
Grill, broil, poach, fry or steam the chicken just until done. How you cook the chicken will affect the flavor and texture of the salad. Grilling will give the salad a lovely smoky taste and aroma while frying will give the chicken, and the salad, better texture. You choose which cooking method you prefer. I poached mine.
d1b7a0b8-2437-45eb-901c-a298f132e8e9
Cool the chicken then chill in a covered container for a couple of hours or overnight.
d1b7a0b8-2437-45eb-901c-a298f132e8e9
Take the chicken out of the fridge. Discard the bones. Cut the meat into one-inch cubes.
d1b7a0b8-2437-45eb-901c-a298f132e8e9
Place the grapes, pineapple and pecans in a bowl. Add the chicken. Toss lightly.
d1b7a0b8-2437-45eb-901c-a298f132e8e9
In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, sour cream and lime juice. Add the to chicken, fruits and nuts. Toss lightly but thoroughly. Taste. Add salt and pepper, as needed.
d1b7a0b8-2437-45eb-901c-a298f132e8e9
Serve the chicken salad with pecans, grapes and pineapple at once while all the ingredients are still cold. Or chill in the fridge for at least an hour before serving.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
Rinse and scrub the pearl potatoes well. If more than one inch in diameter, you may want to cut them into halves or quarters. Place in a pan, cover with water, add the vinegar and about a teaspoon of salt. Bring to the boil. Lower the heat, cover and simmer until a skewer inserted at the center goes through with no resistance.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
While the potatoes cook, steam the corn. How long this process takes depends on the variety of corn you use. On the average, 20 to 30 minutes should be long enough.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
Drain the potatoes and transfer to a plate to cool.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
Take the corn off the steamer and cool.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
Roughly chop the red onion and bell pepper.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
Take the cooled ears of corn and cut off the kernels.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
Make the dressing. Place the butter and garlic in a microwaveable bowl. Heat on HIGH for 45 seconds to one minute or until the butter is fully melted. Stir in the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
Place the potatoes, corn kernels, red onion, bell pepper, scallions and dill in a bowl. Toss to distribute the ingredients evenly. Pour in the dressing and toss some more.
260f5a5c-955c-4883-8d01-9c4038183eaf
Allow the potato corn salad with lemon butter garlic dressing to sit on the counter for about ten minutes before serving.
ff20ad5d-127b-499b-bad2-f06e1cd62d8f
8cc366a0-28cc-42a6-9de0-d97ad2932ea0
26c85c2a-16d1-40bd-9f01-600a03b399db
77a0f301-43c6-48a2-9cf5-995e9b8c7a9e
a141e71a-6cd6-4159-9533-b9c59cef1fa5
55dde7d5-86a2-45f9-9852-bf36a588387c
Cut the scallions into half-inch lengths.
55dde7d5-86a2-45f9-9852-bf36a588387c
Peel and roughly chop the onion.
f444ffc7-9b80-45d6-8421-2bc642e6957f
cfbc94af-4ae9-4300-b788-69681f7e565b
8f2f7259-9df4-4392-9572-84176abe9485
f1299654-c2d2-47dc-bc86-14f552d25382
c5b6a85f-7b04-4c3c-bd01-c38582d5ac70
61501afa-1d29-4e66-b727-0d0e1689a45b
d7ff3176-da3b-4743-b7bc-0fd16cebff29
aecf98eb-e935-44a0-84f7-261515f4ce80
5c29c516-aa0d-455a-8853-4046ded839d5
554bcedb-5ed8-4392-9475-4b878e03aeab
6b30722b-49bb-47e2-ad03-aa258823cfa1
d7eb7882-a89e-4782-9d72-5f83571e904f
5e3009c5-c0f2-410d-ba3c-b12a079e7b0e
badc9ec0-9cfa-49bc-9b0b-6367d1001e01
Pat the chicken thighs dry with paper towels.
badc9ec0-9cfa-49bc-9b0b-6367d1001e01
In a bowl, mix together all the seasonings for the chicken, add the chicken and rub the seasonings well into the meat.
e7caa314-65cd-4d40-8f01-dc1d9b4a3ad7
762e0bd5-f70e-4aa7-8852-4de0db0a194e
ae37bf2c-4be4-423b-996b-86da14e0af2a
41731b52-3368-4927-9f37-bd1bd2203cc6
d1e1a76d-552b-4eb3-ad73-a45950393663
1009d1a4-7697-49cd-8a62-8913e4b6b09d
Dice the tomatoes and onion and place in a large bowl.
1009d1a4-7697-49cd-8a62-8913e4b6b09d
Tear the salmon into large chunks; add to the bowl.
1009d1a4-7697-49cd-8a62-8913e4b6b09d
Tear (or cut) the cilantro and add to the salmon and vegetables.
1009d1a4-7697-49cd-8a62-8913e4b6b09d
Season with salt and pepper.
1009d1a4-7697-49cd-8a62-8913e4b6b09d
Add the chili flakes, pour in the lemon juice and mango sauce and toss lightly.
1009d1a4-7697-49cd-8a62-8913e4b6b09d
I recommend chilling before serving to allow the flavors to blend. It’s really wonderful — no superlatives can suffice.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Soak the sotanghon and wood ear mushrooms in hot water in separate bowls.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Stir the annatto powder and oil, and pour into a sauce pan, and turn on the heat.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Lay the chicken fillets, skin side down, in the oil and cook medium-high heat for a minute or two to render fat from the skin. Flip and cook for another minute.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Pour in the broth. Season with patis and pepper.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Bring to the boil.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Dump the cabbage and carrot into the pan.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Drain the sotanghon and add to the vegetables in the pan.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Drain the wood ear mushrooms, trim, slice and add to the sotanghon and vegetables.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Simmer everything together for five minutes.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Taste the broth and add more patis, if needed.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Scoop out the chicken and move to a cutting board.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Cut the chicken into strips and put back in the pan.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
Simmer the chicken sotanghon soup for another five to seven minutes.
f568a3c3-39fd-4643-9b9e-a3ec19725d79
To serve, ladle the chicken sotanghon soup into bowls and sprinkle with sliced scallions and fried garlic.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
Preheat the oven to 425F.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
Arrange the pork ribs on a rack in a single layer. Place a tray beneath the rack to catch the drippings.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
Roast the pork ribs for 15 to 20 minutes until browned in spots.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
Meanwhile, pour about eight cups of water in a pot.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
Add the onion, garlic and peppercorns. Bring to the boil.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
After 15 to 20 minutes in the oven, take out the pork ribs.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
With the liquid in the pot boiling profusely, drop the pork ribs one at a time. Season with three tablespoons patis (fish sauce).
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
When the liquid is boiling once more, turn down the heat to low, cover the pot and simmer the pork for an hour to an hour and a half.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
When the pork is almost done, or about 20 minutes before cooking time is up, drop the cabbage and sweet potatoes into the broth, and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
0e6d30d4-2af8-48e0-b264-b55e1aea45a5
Taste the broth one last time, add more patis if necessary, simmer for another five minutes or until the vegetables are done.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Place the chicken pieces in a large thick-bottomed pot. Pour in enough water to cover. Set over high heat and bring to the boil and leave to boil briskly for five minutes
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Strain the chicken and discard the water. Rinse the chicken pieces and make sure to get rid of any impurities.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Place the rinsed chicken in a clean pot and pour in the chicken bone broth. Set over high heat.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
With a sharp pointed knife, pierce the garlic in several places, and add to the chicken.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Add the onion, peppercorns about two tablespoons of patis to the chicken.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
When the liquid comes to a boil, lower the heat, cover the pot and simmer for 40 minutes. Taste occasionally and add more patis, as needed.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Add the white cabbage and potatoes to the chicken. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Taste the broth and add more patis, if needed (see notes after the recipe).
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Drop in the sweet potato wedges. Simmer for 10 minutes.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Taste the broth again and add more patis, as needed. Add the Chinese cabbage leaves, pressing them into the broth. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
e27b02b9-2721-4c72-ab15-cdb65705cdf2
Taste the broth one last time, adding more patis, as needed, before serving.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Reserve 1/4 cup of broth and heat the rest in a pot until boiling.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Add the cauliflower florets to the broth, lower the heat, cover the pot and simmer for five minutes.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Dissolve the tapioca starch in the reserved broth and pour into the pot. Cook, stirring, until the broth has thickened and is no longer cloudy.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Stir in the spinach leaves and chicken meat.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Taste the broth; add salt and pepper, as needed.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Bring the soup to a gentle boil and cotinue cooking, uncovered and with occasional stirring, for a few minutes.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Whisk the eggs in bowl.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Turn off the heat. Pour the eggs in a thin stream over the entire surface of the soup. Leave to set for a few seconds before stirring.
6dd42368-0f2f-4479-978a-37a33205eb2b
Taste the soup one last time and adjust the seasonings, if needed, before serving.
11de9351-bb89-450f-a343-3f11e563814d
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
Rinse the pork ribs and pat dry with a kitchen towel.
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
Heat the cooking oil in a large pot.
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
Saute the shallots and ginger until softened and highly aromatic.
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
Turn up the heat, add the pork ribs and cook until lightly browned on all sides.
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
Pour in about two tablespoons of fish sauce. Continue cooking, turning the ribs occasionally, until the meat has absorbed the fish sauce and the mixture is starting to turn dry.
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
Pour in enough water to cover the pork ribs and bring to the boil.
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
Cover the pot and simmer the pork ribs for an hour to two hours (ribs from older animals require a longer cooking time to tenderize the meat). Taste occasionally and add fish sauce in stages.
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
When the pork is done and you have a rich tasty broth, add the chayote wedges and spinach, and continue simmering until the vegetables are done.
b042bd56-522d-4744-acda-983f353a2bf8
Serve the pork ribs tinola as a starter course or with rice as a main course.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Split the coconut (or have it done by the vendor), save the juice and scrape the meat to separate it from the husk.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Cut the coconut meat into thin strips.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Cut the bangus belly fillets into one to two-inch pieces. Smaller or larger, that depends on you.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Peel and thinly slice the shallot and ginger.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Pick the sili leaves from the stalks; discard the stalks.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Heat the cooking oil in a sauce pan.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Saute the ginger and shallot until aromatic, about four minutes.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Pour in the coconut juice and stir in the coconut meat. Season with patis and pepper. Bring to the boil.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Add the bangus belly, season with more patis and bring to the boil.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Lower the heat and simmer for one minute (a little longer if you cut your bangus belly into larger pieces). DO NOT overcook the fish.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Turn off the heat. Add the sili leaves and push them down into the soup.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Cover the pan and leave for five minutes to allow the fish to cook completely in the residual heat and to wilt the sili leaves.
cb4bf628-1d07-40ff-a340-450361766387
Taste and adjust the seasonings before serving your bangus belly binakol.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Heat a thick-bottomed pot and lay the duck, skin side down. It will immediately sizzle as the fat in the skin starts to melt immediately. Leave it like that until the skin is nicely browned and a couple of tablespoons of duck fat has been rendered. Flip the duck over.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Add the ginger and shallots to the duck. Stir them in the fat.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Drizzle in about a tablespoon of fish sauce and sprinkle in black pepper generously.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Lower the heat and cover the pot to allow the ginger and shallots to brown lightly.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Meanwhile, cut the coconut meat into thin strips.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
When the ginger and shallots are lightly browned, add the coconut strips and water. Stir.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Simmer the duck, coconut meat and spices in the coconut water for an hour. DO NOT dilute with tap water. Taste the broth after 30 minutes and add more fish sauce, as needed.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Scoop out the duck and cool on a rack. Let the coconut meat and spices continue to simmer in the broth.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Pick the meat from the duck and tear into bite-size pieces. Discard the bone.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Add the duck meat back into the pot. Simmer for another 20 minutes.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Turn off the heat. Press the sili leaves into the broth. Cover the pot and leave to allow the sili leaves to wilt in the residual heat.
a7d4bd1d-f613-4371-b7bf-ca91ebfbebdf
Serve the duck binakol immediately.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Heat the cooking oil in a pot.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Saute the garlic and shallots until lightly browned and fragrant.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Pour in six to eight cups of water. Bring to a simmer.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Lower the fish bone into the pot. Cook over low heat just until the flesh attached to the bone turns opaque.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Lift the bone out of the liquid, transfer to a plate and cool.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Carefully separate the salmon flesh from the bone.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Return the bone to the pot, pour in two tablespoons of fish sauce, sprinkle in the pepper and simmer for 15 minutes or so.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Remove the fish bones from the broth and discard.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Taste the broth. Add more fish sauce, of needed.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Plunge the spinach into the liquid. Cook just until wilted.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Add the salmon flesh to the soup. Stir gently.
c1c1af51-e9fc-4a5b-a1ab-d5021d491248
Taste the broth. Adjust the seasonings, if needed, before serving.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Add the chicken pieces skin side down. Cook until the skin is lightly browned. Flip and brown the opposite sides.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Drizzle in two tablespoons of fish sauce. Cook until the mixture is quite dry.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Pour in the coconut water. Drizzle in more fish sauce.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Dump in the coconut meat.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Bring to a gentle boil, lower the heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until the chicken is done.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Turn off the heat. Fish out the chicken, move to a plate and cool.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Flake the chicken meat; discard the bones.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Turn on the heat. Add the chicken meat and spinach to the soup. Taste the broth and season with more fish sauce, if needed. Simmer for another ten minutes.
372ca3d5-2449-4ea1-b86e-790b70e8b0cf
Serve the chicken binakol while piping hot.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
Place the pork ribs in a pot. Cover with water. Boil, uncovered, for ten minutes.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
Pour the ribs into a strainer. Throw out the boiling liquid.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
Rinse each piece of pork well under the tap making sure to remove any scum attached to the meat and bones.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
Wash the pot (or use another) and put the rinsed pork ribs in it. Pour in enough water to cover.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
Place the pot on the stove and turn the heat to high.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
Add all the remaining ingredients to the pork.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
When the liquid boils, lower the heat, cover the bowl and simmer for an hour and a half to two hours or until the meat is very tender and easily separates from the bone. Taste the broth once in a while and add more seasonings, if needed. Tip: if the broth lacks saltiness, you may add salt rather than more soy sauce to prevent the broth from turning too dark.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
If adding shiitake mushrooms, put them in the pot during the last half hour of cooking.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
If adding tofu, drop them into the pot during the last ten minutes of cooking.
b5969e9c-a973-4291-b45c-faf126143689
To serve, put a few pieces of pork ribs, mushrooms and tofu into bowls, ladle in the broth and arrange some greens on the side.
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
Peel the garlic and onion and finely chop.
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
Roughly chop the tomatoes.
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
Heat the olive oil in a pot and saute the garlic and onion until softened.
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
Add the tomatoes and rosemary. Add about a teaspoon of herb salt. Stir. Continue sauteeing until the vegetables liquefy and the mixture is starting to turn dry.
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
Pour in the diced tomatoes and bone broth. Stir. Taste. Add more herb salt, if needed.
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
Bring to a gentle boil, cover the pot, turn down the heat and simmer the soup until reduced by a quarter or more depending on how thick you like your tomato soup.
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
For a smooth tomato soup, plunge an immersion blender into the soup to liquefy the vegetables. It's totally optional. If you do decide to use the immersion blender, discard the rosemary stalk (the edible pointy leaves would have gotten mixed into the soup already so leave them be; it's just the stalk that's too woody to eat).
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
Give the tomato soup one last taste and adjust the seasonings, if needed.
012d7af3-23dd-4139-9782-c486e98b9deb
Serve the tomato soup with herbed croutons, scallions and cream on the side.
7139d2ad-33f4-4a38-96d3-d3aafd5d345a
Cut the corned beef into two-inch cubes.
7139d2ad-33f4-4a38-96d3-d3aafd5d345a
Peel the potatoes and cut into roughly the same size as the corned beef cubes.
7139d2ad-33f4-4a38-96d3-d3aafd5d345a
Cut the cabbage into wedges. You may optionally cut off and discard the core.
7139d2ad-33f4-4a38-96d3-d3aafd5d345a
Heat the bone broth in a pot.
7139d2ad-33f4-4a38-96d3-d3aafd5d345a
Drop in the corned beef, cabbage and potatoes. Bring to a simmer, cover and cook until the vegetables are done.
7139d2ad-33f4-4a38-96d3-d3aafd5d345a
Taste the broth. If your bone broth was originally unseasoned or under-seasoned, you may want to add salt and pepper before serving the soup.
29208d43-b1d4-4022-81a3-1f12e5924ae9
3e9caf9e-133b-421f-b05a-7902f67229af
Discard the mussels that do not open. Rinse under running water again. Pull out the “beards”. Set aside.
3e9caf9e-133b-421f-b05a-7902f67229af
Heat a large pot. Pour in the cooking oil. Saute the shallot, ginger and garlic until softened and aromatic.
3e9caf9e-133b-421f-b05a-7902f67229af
Pour in the water. Season with fish sauce and pepper. Bring to a full boil. Do not lower the heat at this point.
3e9caf9e-133b-421f-b05a-7902f67229af
Add the cleaned mussels to the boiling water. When the water is boiling again, lower the heat. Cover and simmer for two to three minutes. Do not overcook the mussels.
3e9caf9e-133b-421f-b05a-7902f67229af
Off the heat, taste the broth and add more fish sauce and pepper, as needed.
3e9caf9e-133b-421f-b05a-7902f67229af
Garnish the gingered mussel soup with sliced scallions before serving.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Slow cook the oxtail Place the oxtail in a pot. Cover with water. Boil for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse well.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Slow cook the oxtail Place the rinsed oxtail in the slow cooker. Pour in enough water to cover. Add the garlic, shallots, peppercorns and salt.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Slow cook the oxtail Slow cook the oxtail for eight hours on high or up to 12 hours on low.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Cook the sinigang Strain the cooked oxtail. Reserve the broth.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Cook the sinigang Heat the cooking oil in a pot. Saute the garlic, shallots, tomatoes and finger chili.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Cook the sinigang Pour in the oxtail broth. If there isn't enough, pour in all of the bone broth as well. For four people, you will need six to eight cups for broth for generous servings. Season with fish sauce. Bring to the boil.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Cook the sinigang Start dropping in the vegetables beginning with what takes longest to cook. I drop in the okra and taro first. The sitaw follows after five minutes. Then, after another five minutes, the kangkong stalks and eggplants. After another five minutes, the kangkong leaves and radish go in.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Cook the sinigang Add the strained oxtail to the vegetables in the pot.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Cook the sinigang Stir in the tamarind juice. Taste and add more fish sauce, if needed.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Cook the sinigang Bring to a simmer and cook, covered, for another five minutes.
b82bc743-b1e3-4e40-91b2-ad1940472829 Cook the sinigang Taste the sinigang broth one last time and add more fish sauce, if needed, before serving.
18f6a126-16d7-497c-9060-871992f54abb
Add the corned beef cubes. Cook, stirring, until the meat changes color.
18f6a126-16d7-497c-9060-871992f54abb
Pour in the bone broth. Add the finger chilies. Season with patis. Bring to the boil, cover and simmer for two to two and a half hours, or until the beef is tender.
18f6a126-16d7-497c-9060-871992f54abb
About 20 minutes before the beef is done, add the taro wedges.
18f6a126-16d7-497c-9060-871992f54abb
When the eggplants are almost done, pour in the tamarind extract and add the kangkong to the pot, pressing the kangkong down gently into the broth. Let boil for five minutes. Taste the broth and add more patis if necessary.
d1acc429-b0f7-46af-b5ab-8fa49bca2263
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Keep the beef stew simmering on the stove while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Blanch the noodles in boiling water for a minute. Drain. Plunge in iced water and allow to cool. Drain. Divide among six bowls.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Blanch the spinach in boiling water just long enough to wilt. Scoop out and divide into six portions.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Place one portion of spinach in every bowl on one side of the noodles.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Rinse the mung bean sprouts well and drain. Divide into six portions.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Ladle simmering broth directly into the bowls.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Arrange a few pieces of beef on one side of the noodles in the bowl.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Place a portion of mung bean sprouts in every bowl alongside.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Sprinkle in toasted sesame seeds and sliced scallions.
bce065a4-e784-45b2-8aef-76c15255eeba
Serve the spicy beef noodle soup at once.
b3198bd3-139b-455d-a58e-62df5ed3c228
Reserve half a cup of broth. Pour the rest into a pot and heat to boiling point.
b3198bd3-139b-455d-a58e-62df5ed3c228
Stir the starch in the reserved broth until completely dispersed. Pour into the broth. Cook, stirring, until the broth is thickened and clear.
b3198bd3-139b-455d-a58e-62df5ed3c228
If the broth is unseasoned, add salt and pepper at this point. Start with a tablespoon of salt and a quarter teaspoon of pepper. You can add more later, if needed.
b3198bd3-139b-455d-a58e-62df5ed3c228
Add the sliced shiitake, white asparagus and broccoli to the broth. Stir. Optionally, you may pour in the liquid from the can of asparagus but you may need to add more starch solution to prevent the broth from getting too thin.
b3198bd3-139b-455d-a58e-62df5ed3c228
Lower the heat, cover the pot and cook the soup for seven to ten minutes.
b3198bd3-139b-455d-a58e-62df5ed3c228
Taste the soup and add more salt and pepper, if needed.
b3198bd3-139b-455d-a58e-62df5ed3c228
Turn off the heat. Drizzle the beaten eggs into the soup. Let sit for a few seconds before stirring. If you're more particular about whether the eggs should be wispy or chunky, see two ways to make egg drop soup.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Make the filling In a bowl, mix together the ground pork, shrimps, chopped carrot, scallions and shiitake mushrooms with salt and pepper. Set aside.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Prepare the cabbage and scallions For the cabbage, follow the instructions in the other cabbage rolls recipe.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Prepare the cabbage and scallions Plunge the whole scallions in boiling water for a minute then hang on the edge of the strainer where you're draining the cabbage.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Lay a trimmed cabbage leaf on your work surface. Position it so that the thicker side is pointing towards you.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Place a heaping tablespoon of filling near the center.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Fold the thick side of the cabbage leaf over the filling. Then, fold in the left and right sides. Roll the cabbage leaf away from you to seal in the filling.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Take one piece of softened scallion and use it to tie the cabbage roll like a parcel.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Repeat until all the cabbage leaves have been filled and tied.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Pour the bone broth into a pot. Add the lemongrass, garlic, ginger and chilies. Bring to the boil. Taste. Add fish sauce, as needed.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Drop the cabbage rolls one by one into the hot broth.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls When the broth begins to simmer, set the heat to low, cover the pan and cook the cabbage rolls in the bone broth for 20 to 30 minutes.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Scoop out the cabbage rolls and place in soup bowls.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Strain the broth. Stir in the lime juice. Taste and add more fish sauce, if needed.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Pour hot broth over the cabbage rolls.
cd288573-ca6d-4381-8e2e-994ebc3fc872 Assemble the cabbage rolls Garnish the Thai cabbage rolls soup with torn cilantro and lime wedges before serving.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
If the thighs are still attached to the back, cut the chicken into serving size pieces. Set aside.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Peel and finely slice the shallots
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Peel and mince the garlic.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Peel and grate the ginger.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Slit the chilies vertically.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Heat two tablespoons cooking oil in a thick-bottomed pot.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Saute the shallots until lightly browned. Add the garlic, ginger and chilies. Drizzle in a little fish sauce. Continue sauteeing until the shallot slices are soft and browned. Scoop out the sauteed aromatics.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Pour in the remaining tablespoon of cooking oil into the pot.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Lay the chicken pieces in the hot oil, skin side down, and cook over high heat until the skins are blistered and browned. Flip the pieces to brown the opposite sides.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Return the sauteed aromatics into the pan.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Pour enough water to cover the chicken pieces in the pan.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Drizzle in more fish sauce. Sprinkle in some ground black pepper.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
When the contents of the pot are boiling, set the heat to low, cover the pot and cook until the chicken is done. Taste the broth once in a while and add more fish sauce, as needed.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
When the chicken is done, scatter the chili leaves on the surface of the soup. Turn off the heat. Cover the pot and leave the chili leaves to cook in the residual heat for about five minutes.
6e851777-9e5c-42fe-a702-82c5dd448f33
Serve your pinatisang manok hot.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
Using a mandolin slicer, thinly slice the corn kernels off the cobs. Scrape off with a knife whatever portion of the kernels are left attached to the cobs.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
Boil the scrap bones in plenty of water. Drain. Rinse well.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
Place the bones in a clean pot. Add the sliced corn. Pour in enough water so that there is at least two inches of water above the corn and bones. Bring to the boil.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
While waiting for the corn and bones and corn to come to a boil, peel the onion and roughly chop.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
When the corn and bones are boiling, add the chopped onion. Season the soup generously with fish sauce and and two pinches of ground pepper.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
Lower the heat, cover and simmer until the corn is soft and the broth is thickened. Stir occasionally to make sure nothing sticks to the bottom of the pot. Taste occasionally too and adjust the seasonings, if needed.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
When the corn is soft, add the okra and cubed squash. Stir. Cover the pot and simmer for 10 minutes.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
Taste the soup. Add more fish sauce and / or pepper, as needed.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
Add the squash blossoms, squash vine leaves and spinach to the pot. Stir. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
7d6dcade-aff4-4e2f-82d4-8059a8b9343f
Give the white corn soup with squash blossoms a final taste. Adjust the seasonings one last time, if needed. Serve the soup hot. Topped with chicharon, if you like.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Cut the bacon into thin strips.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Slice the sausages diagonally, about 1/4-inch thick.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Peel and mince the garlic.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Peel and roughly chop the onion.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Dice the tomatoes.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Peel the potatoes and carrot. Cut into half-inch cubes.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Cut the cabbage into half-inch wide strips.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Heat a saute pan, add the bacon and cook until fat has been rendered. Add the sausage slices and cook until both the bacon and sausages are lightly browned. Scoop the bacon and sausages into the slow cooker.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
In the remaining fat in the pan, saute the garlic, onion and tomatoes until softened. Add, with the fat, to the bacon and sausages in the slow cooker.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Throw the potatoes, carrot and cabbage into the slow cooker.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Pour in the chicken broth. Sprinkle in some salt (not too much because both the bacon and sausages are salty) and pepper. Add the cayenne, paprika, bay leaves and sauerkraut. Stir. Push the ham bone into the contents of the slow cooker.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Set the slow cooker to HIGH. Cook until simmering (it takes about an hour). Set the heat to LOW and cook for three to four hours or until the vegetables are soft.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Taste the soup and adjust the seasonings.
e54a44df-f83b-467d-855c-194977a4611b
Sprinkle your Polish-style cabbage, potato and sausage soup with dill before serving with crusty bread.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
Melt the butter in a pan.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
Add the chopped bacon to the butter and cook until crisp. Scoop out and set aside.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
To the mixture of bacon fat and butter, add the flour all at once. Stir to remove lumps. Throw in the thyme. Cook over medium heat for about five minutes, stirring occasionally, to make a blonde roux.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
Pour in 1 and 1/2 cups of clam broth and one cup of milk. Cook, stirring, until thickened.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
Stir in one cup of mashed potatoes.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
Taste the soup and season with salt and pepper, as needed.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
If the soup appears too thick, add more clam broth, milk or mashed potatoes, or all of them. Remember to taste and adjust the seasonings after each addition.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
When you're happy with the texture of the soup, add the clams. Simmer for about five minutes.
61e0438c-6730-4043-8ba1-9c1eb8da8203
Sprinkle the bacon and parsley on the clam chowder before serving.
f21f97b8-ba8b-4c77-8002-474896d76b08
Pour the broth into a pot and start heating.
f21f97b8-ba8b-4c77-8002-474896d76b08
While waiting for the broth to boil, peel the sweet potato and cut into half-inch cubes.
f21f97b8-ba8b-4c77-8002-474896d76b08
Thinly slice the celery.
f21f97b8-ba8b-4c77-8002-474896d76b08
Cut the sausages into half-inch thick rings.
f21f97b8-ba8b-4c77-8002-474896d76b08
Cut the kale leaves horizontally into three to four pieces.
f21f97b8-ba8b-4c77-8002-474896d76b08
When the broth boils, add the sweet potato cubes, celery, sliced sausages, fried shallots and a sprinkle each of salt and pepper. Stir. When the broth reaches boiling point once more, lower the heat, cover the pot and simmer for 15 minutes.
f21f97b8-ba8b-4c77-8002-474896d76b08
Taste the broth. If it needs more salt and pepper, add just enough to acquire a good balance.
f21f97b8-ba8b-4c77-8002-474896d76b08
Serve the kale, sweet potato and sausage soup at once.
6c712992-2f03-4982-bb25-9e3caeb4f418
Heat the vegetable broth in a pot.
6c712992-2f03-4982-bb25-9e3caeb4f418
When the broth starts to boil, add the green beans, carrot, sliced shiitake, corn kernels and onion flakes.
6c712992-2f03-4982-bb25-9e3caeb4f418
Season with salt and pepper.
6c712992-2f03-4982-bb25-9e3caeb4f418
When the broth starts to simmer, cover the pot, turn down the heat to low and simmer the vegetables and mushroom for five minutes.
6c712992-2f03-4982-bb25-9e3caeb4f418
Dissolve the starch in a tablespoon of water. Pour into soup. Stir well. Cover the pot once more and continue cooking the soup for another five minutes or until the vegetables are done.
6c712992-2f03-4982-bb25-9e3caeb4f418
Turn off the heat. Drizzle the beaten eggs into the soup in a circular motion. Let sit for about ten seconds (see two ways to make egg drop soup). Stir.
6c712992-2f03-4982-bb25-9e3caeb4f418
Serve the corn and mushroom egg drop soup while hot.
0ad31254-2698-4447-bfbc-de94fc0ceb4c
d0607d11-7071-4c6a-b975-e12321998b3a
7fcf0704-2f47-4991-b45b-972a4be86e08

0f3599d8-479d-4c9b-b696-b3a83e93c3bd
935a86d4-3b0f-4648-9e70-ba0fc1c224bd
747b3818-677b-4e2d-83d6-c29fcb8846cb
747b3818-677b-4e2d-83d6-c29fcb8846cb
747b3818-677b-4e2d-83d6-c29fcb8846cb
4e858a3a-9502-4842-97f2-98de63f58e41
6a96b0fb-23d8-4499-bfe7-3ac899e144da

f360dd2e-9117-4cff-a372-c429038ca58e
8e0c3641-e377-432a-ba36-f89c6d26dc5d
When the broth simmers, drop in the tofu and fried shallots, if using.
f6610c4d-2f95-4508-9bd5-cdee7e2c39f7
af59c681-e522-449c-9fa5-506186ef2821
Ladle the soup into bowls. Garnish with slices of lime, finely sliced mint leaves and fried shallots.
9daf0cd3-0d9a-4d91-b03f-52466fa260b7
6f0c6fb1-1217-462b-8e19-9e070d20c8dd
31a7a48d-ba07-40ba-9f7c-9469b34bcedc
89b1ec2c-1b6f-4c3b-872e-e873b98563c9
528ae53b-c82b-4bd5-b4b8-b97ce867f228
9330c91d-82f1-4f86-8da1-cf738a93bb9d
1163848c-ab64-4bbf-be03-21b68a686142
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Heat the cooking oil in a thick-bottomed pot. Sweat the onion and garlic until softened.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Add the carrot, beans and corn.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Pour in the broth. Add salt and pepper, as needed, depending on how well seasoned the broth is. Just remember that the spinach paste that you will be adding later is also salted so go easy on the seasonings at this point.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Bring the mixture to a simmer, set the heat to low, cover the pot and cook for about 10 minutes.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Add the zucchini.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Stir in the spinach paste.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Simmer the soup for another 10 minutes.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Taste and adjust the seasonings.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Off the heat, stir in some chopped parsley.
b6754048-9425-43ac-85e7-2ef7365ed758
Top with shaved cheese (optional but recommended) and serve.
3e88aa39-2ee1-4277-ad73-d3dd85580d1c
Add the Chinese broccoli stems and crisp fried shallots. Simmer for another five to seven minutes.
0fca73df-13d8-47d9-92a9-5a40e886611a
ee5c5cdf-0f25-4556-ad9b-3fbddbab9f9f
7167b098-b002-4099-9c0a-2ee9aa837a8a
997f66c3-5464-4c96-adb7-600f3e47de57
c25f03dd-d557-4c4f-bcdb-bef27fc6c649

965020f8-b42d-481f-9d86-cc86133ee715
6ca5ea36-8b84-49b7-bdaa-b373380a03f3
80c8b97c-9d49-4d45-b047-d9523010e941
8f8caca4-432c-49b2-a4d4-41da99aca9bf
bbf64cd9-31d5-41ab-80f7-361f7619c3da
665dbad2-bdd4-4857-94b3-a1cf42039c0c
