891364c9-c31e-439f-b8fa-4b8b92621702
3ac69f89-1649-4e77-8c80-f67c1ffac555
5a9fed60-43fd-4fa3-a917-4b410b866b6f
144f628b-8317-4077-9dd4-b7c4ac64797f
ff256191-065e-4ca9-9c2b-f46389f5801c Make ahead
ff256191-065e-4ca9-9c2b-f46389f5801c About 15 minutes before serving time
ff256191-065e-4ca9-9c2b-f46389f5801c To serve Ladle the soup into bowls. Make sure everyone gets some whole cauliflower florets. Garnish with sliced scallions, fried shallots and crisp garlic bits.
d13b6b20-d462-4d8d-9450-b0eb4aa6a839
bf7cec79-71eb-44fe-b302-6710754f7c39
Heat two tablespoonfuls of butter in a pot. Add the chopped onion and cook over medium heat to “sweat.”
bf7cec79-71eb-44fe-b302-6710754f7c39
When soft and translucent, add the potatoes.
bf7cec79-71eb-44fe-b302-6710754f7c39
Pour in about four cups of broth. Bring to the boil, lower the heat, cover and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
bf7cec79-71eb-44fe-b302-6710754f7c39
While the potatoes cook, prepare the meat. Heat the remaining two tablespoonfuls of butter in another pot.
bf7cec79-71eb-44fe-b302-6710754f7c39
Add the meat and sausages, stirring to coat every piece with butter.
bf7cec79-71eb-44fe-b302-6710754f7c39
Pour in about two cups of broth, bring to the boil then lower the heat, cover and simmer.
67acfa7b-3633-4790-8ed4-95a051a66859
To make soup for one, pour the broth in a small sauce pan. Add the peas and some scallions.
67acfa7b-3633-4790-8ed4-95a051a66859
Pour everything — broth, peas and scallions — into the blender and puree.
fed9119f-b472-4786-bd43-058a41afb459
63c34e0d-8bb5-459b-ac6d-adcb615a27a9
a1ec7cf0-5ba1-4627-9c58-bcab43b14ac6
Heat the cooking oil in a pot. Saute the garlic, ginger, onion, chilis and lemongrass until fragrant.
a1ec7cf0-5ba1-4627-9c58-bcab43b14ac6
Add the chicken strips and cook until no longer pink.
a1ec7cf0-5ba1-4627-9c58-bcab43b14ac6
Add the kaffir lime leaves. Stir and cook for a couple of minutes.
3d210564-de82-4e42-a663-e07f4dc60d24
d87d42c8-2fcd-4cc9-b26a-2ee6ab8c90ad
183cb07a-e5a9-4f8d-b163-5f8c3512ea03
5bc91933-4b86-445a-87f5-39ed32abf278
96762303-38b5-4142-ac60-226b12eeb5d6
96762303-38b5-4142-ac60-226b12eeb5d6
eead8172-7f94-4a7a-86fd-b71e0e3107ab
Peel and thinly slice the shallots.
eead8172-7f94-4a7a-86fd-b71e0e3107ab
Dice the tomatoes.
eead8172-7f94-4a7a-86fd-b71e0e3107ab
Peel and mince the garlic.
eead8172-7f94-4a7a-86fd-b71e0e3107ab
Heat the cooking oil in a thick-bottomed pot.
eead8172-7f94-4a7a-86fd-b71e0e3107ab
Pour in four to five cups of chicken broth. Yes, it is quite alright to simply use water IF you're using bone-in chicken. If you're substituting fillets because they are more convenient to serve and easier to eat, water just won't coax enough flavor from them to make a tasty broth.
95d01fed-f773-4e68-aeab-f86779ecc782
4ebbabe1-7b02-4c85-9883-77b8a92d12a1
63fc1024-b612-4c57-aa0d-b406f3f893c2
c1f1d9d4-4a81-4b63-b558-1b9ac70f2419
03d75fa5-05b7-40be-811c-2ab5c3bbcbce
d38d3c3e-af8b-4356-b49d-552c1e97ba59
54bf721f-a9d5-4f82-99e4-1149082654ba
df96c595-4698-4bcb-9bf4-df06872a8148
792495ab-fe14-4c4f-b5ff-a6b3ed17b60e
cb39c1ee-51c8-44a5-bcea-eb56a6959bee
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
In another pan (large enough to contain the broth and all the other ingredients), heat the butter.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
Saute the onion slices until they start to turn soft.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
Add the beef, stirring to separate, and cook just until the meat changes color.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
With a slotted spoon, remove the beef and onions, transfer to a bowl and keep warm.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
When the broth boils, pour into the pan with the butter.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
Add the cooked pasta, cauliflower and peas.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
Bring to the boil once more then simmer for about five minutes or just until the cauliflower is done but not mushy.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
Return the beef and onion to the pan. Stir.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
Pour in the milk, stirring as you pour.
d0931afc-6613-4957-afb7-ae34045772ec
Season with salt and pepper.
30add578-da0a-4df6-8409-1740622360e0
Place the bones in a pot. Boil for 10 minutes until the scum rises.
30add578-da0a-4df6-8409-1740622360e0
Throw out the water, rinse the bones and the pot.
30add578-da0a-4df6-8409-1740622360e0
Return the bones to the pot, refill with water, add the onion, garlic and peppercorns, season with fish sauce and simmer for at least two hours.
30add578-da0a-4df6-8409-1740622360e0
To serve, place the bones at the center of a large bowl, surround with the noodles, top with the trimmed herbs and pour in the simmering broth.
30add578-da0a-4df6-8409-1740622360e0
Garnish with slices of lime, squeeze half a lime over everything and serve at once.
dbf664ad-522a-4bef-8962-404fb8b94aaf
c9adb7dd-d4e2-4e3d-8893-86389d8c6bf1
Heat the broth.
c9adb7dd-d4e2-4e3d-8893-86389d8c6bf1
Add the onion and bring to the boil.
c9adb7dd-d4e2-4e3d-8893-86389d8c6bf1
Add the chicken, broccoli stem and carrot, season with patis and pepper and bring to the boil once more.
c9adb7dd-d4e2-4e3d-8893-86389d8c6bf1
Add the broccoli florets and the rolls of misua. When the soup reaches the boiling point once more, turn off the heat, cover and leave for three minutes.
c9adb7dd-d4e2-4e3d-8893-86389d8c6bf1
Serve at once.
a982257f-9917-42c8-9a5c-7d2ed8ddcae3
f8cea4ab-7bc6-4bab-b8ee-0f0eabbc3b0d
65929095-a762-4786-b78d-8ef11992570b
43b03152-5adc-41db-80a0-ce7a1b646053
Heat a large saucepan or casserole. Transfer 1 tbsp. of cooking oil from the skillet or wok.
43b03152-5adc-41db-80a0-ce7a1b646053
Saute the garlic and onion until the onion is soft.
43b03152-5adc-41db-80a0-ce7a1b646053
Pour in the broth. Bring to a boil.
43b03152-5adc-41db-80a0-ce7a1b646053
Add the meat balls. Lower the heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
43b03152-5adc-41db-80a0-ce7a1b646053
Adjust seasonings, as needed. Turn off the heat.
43b03152-5adc-41db-80a0-ce7a1b646053
Add the misua and cover for another 5 minutes.
43b03152-5adc-41db-80a0-ce7a1b646053
Transfer to a soup tureen and top with sliced scallions. Serve hot.
e039691a-b528-4e2e-b23a-36f23b411669
Slice the mangoes to remove the stones. Cut the mango meat into small squares without piercing the skin. Scoop out with a spoon directly into a bowl.
e039691a-b528-4e2e-b23a-36f23b411669
Peel the cucumbers, scoop out and discard the seeds, then cut the cucumber flesh into cubes about the same size as the mangoes.
e039691a-b528-4e2e-b23a-36f23b411669
Cut the mangoes into halves, scoop out and discard the seeds, then cut the flesh into small cubes (see notes after the recipe).
e039691a-b528-4e2e-b23a-36f23b411669
Peel and roughly chop the onions.
e039691a-b528-4e2e-b23a-36f23b411669
Add the cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, scallions and cilantro to the mango in the bowl. Toss gently.
e039691a-b528-4e2e-b23a-36f23b411669
Stir together all the ingredients for the dressing until the no solids are visible.
e039691a-b528-4e2e-b23a-36f23b411669
Drizzle half of the dressing over the contents of the bowl. Toss everything together. Taste. If under-dressed, drizzle in the remaining dressing and toss a few more times.
e2c42932-a8ac-429d-8837-3f36405c0a60
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Prep the salad components Thinly slice the mushrooms.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Prep the salad components Peel, halve and thinly slice the onion.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Prep the salad components Tear the lettuce into bite-size pieces, rinse thoroughly and dry in a salad spinner.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Saute the mushrooms Over medium heat, melt the two tablespoons butter in a large frying pan. Tilt the pan around to cover the entire bottom.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Saute the mushrooms Spread the mushrooms slices evenly in the pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Leave for about two minutes to allow the undersides to brown a little then cook, stirring often, for another two to three minutes until lightly browned.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Saute the mushrooms Scoop out the mushrooms and transfer to a bowl.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Make the dressing Peel and grate the garlic.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Make the dressing Add the garlic to the pan drippings and cook over medium-low heat for about 10 seconds.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Make the dressing Off the heat, add the rest of the butter. Swirl the pan until the butter is just melted.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Make the dressing Stir in the lemon juice.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Make the dressing Taste. Add more salt, pepper or lemon juice, or all of them.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Assemble the salad Pour two tablespoons of dressing into a mixing bowl. Tilt the bowl to allow the dressing to spread to the sides.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Assemble the salad Dump in the lettuce. Toss well.
f444d97b-1f27-446a-95e7-a58ead71e074 Assemble the salad Divide the lettuce among four salad bowls. Top with onion slices and the sauteed mushrooms. Drizzle in the remaining dressing. Serve at once.
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
Cut the cauliflower into bite-sized florets.
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
Trim the ends and edges of the snap peas (see guide).
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
Slice the button mushrooms
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
Cut each baby corn into three to four pieces.
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
Heat the olive oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the butter. When the butter melts, stir in the garlic. This is sauteeing so keep the heat at medium.
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
When the aroma of garlic starts to waft through your kitchen (don't wait for the garlic to brown too much!), throw the cauliflower florets and mushrooms into the wok or frying pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute for about two minutes.
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
Add the snap peas and baby corn. Sprinkle with more salt and pepper. Saute for another minute or so.
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
Turn off the heat. Take a piece of vegetable and taste. Add more salt and pepper, if needed.
09f2a715-95fa-47a3-87c8-a774240ef01c
Serve the buttered mixed vegetables at once as a side dish to your meat or seafood main dish, or as a main dish for vegetarians.
afdd4da2-938f-416e-abe0-656e62a0dcaa
Halve the tomatoes, scoop out and discard the centers. Cut the tomatoes into small cubes.
afdd4da2-938f-416e-abe0-656e62a0dcaa
Peel the onion and cut into the same size as the tomato pieces.
afdd4da2-938f-416e-abe0-656e62a0dcaa
Roughly chop the olives.
afdd4da2-938f-416e-abe0-656e62a0dcaa
Cut the cheese into thin slices then cut each slice into small cubes.
afdd4da2-938f-416e-abe0-656e62a0dcaa
In a bowl, toss together the tomatoes, onion, olives and cheese cubes. This is your topping. Set it aside for now.
afdd4da2-938f-416e-abe0-656e62a0dcaa
Prepare the potatoes for French fries and fry in plenty of hot oil (see the step-by-step instructions).
afdd4da2-938f-416e-abe0-656e62a0dcaa
Pile the fried potatoes in a shallow bowl and scatter the topping around them.
afdd4da2-938f-416e-abe0-656e62a0dcaa
Sprinkle chopped rosemary over the potatoes and serve with lemon wedges on the side.
3319d91a-78bc-4025-9fb6-6551e4500251
Boil two cups of water in a wok or frying pan. Dump in the trimmed beans and cook for two to three minutes. Scoop out and drain.
3319d91a-78bc-4025-9fb6-6551e4500251
Discard the water and wipe the wok or drying pan dry. Set the stove to medium heat. Reheat the wok and frying pan.
3319d91a-78bc-4025-9fb6-6551e4500251
Pour in the sesame seed oil.
3319d91a-78bc-4025-9fb6-6551e4500251
Saute the chopped garlic and drained green beans for about half a minute or just until the aroma of garlic starts to waft through the kitchen.
3319d91a-78bc-4025-9fb6-6551e4500251
Pour in the mirin (or whatever rice wine you're using) and soy sauce. Stir.
3319d91a-78bc-4025-9fb6-6551e4500251
Cook the green beans, uncovered, for another two to three minutes or until done and until they have soaked up much of the sauce.
3319d91a-78bc-4025-9fb6-6551e4500251
Transfer the cooked beans on a plate. Spoon the garlic and whatever sauce is left over them.
3319d91a-78bc-4025-9fb6-6551e4500251
Sprinkle in the sesame seeds and serve at once.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Rinse the tofu and pat dry with paper towels. Cut into bite-size pieces.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
In a wok or frying pan, heat enough oil to reach a depth of at least three inches.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Fry the tofu over high heat until golden and crisp. Scoop out and transfer to a strainer.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Pour off the oil leaving only about a teaspoonful.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Reheat the oil and saute the sliced onion until just starting to turn soft, about a minute.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Add the fried tofu back to the pan.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Add the sauces. Pour in about a quarter cup of water. Tip: You may mix the three sauces with water before pouring into the pan to make everything simpler.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Cook, tossing, until the tofu pieces are heated through and evenly coated with sauce.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Off the heat, drizzle in the sesame seed oil and toss the tofu a few more times.
c4eb1a40-a503-4b54-9c3c-5a4fd7de55a5
Transfer the crispy fried tofu with chili garlic sauce to a serving bowl or individual bowls. Sprinkle with sliced scallions before serving.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Heat the olive oil in a small frying pan.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Cook the chickpeas in the hot oil until the surface is starting to brown.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Add the green beans. Cook, stirring often, for a minute.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Add the bell pepper and cook, stirring, for half a minute.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Stir in the tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Tip: if using a lot of feta, use salt sparingly. Stir once more and cook for another half a minute.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Tilt the contents of the frying pan into a salad bowl.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Spread the crumbled feta over the vegetables or crumble a piece of feta directly over them.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Sprinkle in the toasted cashew nuts.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Squeeze the lemon directly over everything making sure that no seeds fall into the bowl.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil over the salad.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Garnish with basil chiffonade.
91791634-5ff8-4e10-b12d-e59f64fb632e
Serve the warm chickpea and green beans salad immediately.
b8eb4b95-93c1-468d-8fd7-c1ce754f8415
Heat the butter in a frying pan. Add the chopped onion. Sprinkle with half of the salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until the onion caramelizes.
b8eb4b95-93c1-468d-8fd7-c1ce754f8415
Add the peppers and broccoli florets. Sprinkle with the remaining salt and pepper. Cook for a few minutes, tossing often, just until the broccoli florets are done.
b8eb4b95-93c1-468d-8fd7-c1ce754f8415
Serve alongside your fried, grilled or broiled meat, seafood or vegetables.
ba8db224-6910-4c43-a317-df47705cdd21 Make the dressing Start by mixing the dressing to give it time for the flavors to develop. Mix all the ingredients together but using only half of the toasted sesame seeds. Set aside.
ba8db224-6910-4c43-a317-df47705cdd21 Prepare the salad Thinly slice the cucumber and mango (peeling is optional) then cut into matchsticks.
ba8db224-6910-4c43-a317-df47705cdd21 Prepare the salad Cut open the mango, avoiding the stone at the middle. Make deep slashes about a quarter inch apart without piercing the skin. Using a spoon, scoop out shallowly to release the thin strips.
ba8db224-6910-4c43-a317-df47705cdd21 Toss the salad Place the cucumber, carrot and mango in a bowl. Using two forks (or the tips of your fingers), toss them lightly but thoroughly to distribute the colors evenly.
ba8db224-6910-4c43-a317-df47705cdd21 Toss the salad Drizzle in two tablespoons of dressing and toss. Taste. Add more dressing, as needed.
ba8db224-6910-4c43-a317-df47705cdd21 Toss the salad Sprinkle in the remaining toasted sesame seeds before serving the cucumber and mango salad with chili lime dressing.
0c6eba52-d9d0-4b7e-a60c-7402c9f2d9f1
Rinse the spinach well to remove any trace of soil or sand. Do the same with the mung bean sprouts. Drain.
0c6eba52-d9d0-4b7e-a60c-7402c9f2d9f1
Fill a medium sized pot with water. Bring to a rolling boil.
0c6eba52-d9d0-4b7e-a60c-7402c9f2d9f1
Half fill two bowls with water and drop in a generous amount of ice.
0c6eba52-d9d0-4b7e-a60c-7402c9f2d9f1
Drop the spinach into the boiling water, pushing down to submerge all of it. Cook for two minutes or just until wilted. Scoop out, with a kitchen spider, let the water drip off and plunge in the first bowl of icy water.
0c6eba52-d9d0-4b7e-a60c-7402c9f2d9f1
Bring the water in the pot to boiling point once more. Drop in the mung bean sprouts and cook for half a minute. Scoop out, allow the excess water to drip off and plunge in the second bowl of icy water.
0c6eba52-d9d0-4b7e-a60c-7402c9f2d9f1
Drain the spinach. Squeeze with your hands to remove as much water as you can. Roughly chop.
0c6eba52-d9d0-4b7e-a60c-7402c9f2d9f1
Drain the mung bean sprouts.
0c6eba52-d9d0-4b7e-a60c-7402c9f2d9f1
In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients for the dressing. Add the spinach and mung bean sprouts. Toss gently and serve.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Peel and finely chop the onion.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Halve the tomatoes, scoop out the seeds and discard. Chop the flesh.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Roll the kaffir lime leaves, cut into fine slices then chop.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Finely chop the chilies. Tip: For milder heat, scrape off and discard the seeds.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Heat the cooking oil in a pan.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Saute the onion, tomatoes, kaffir lime leaves, chilies and cilantro stems with a dash of fish sauce and a pinch of pepper. Keep the heat on medium low. Stir often. When the vegetables soften, turn off the heat.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Stir the kaffir lime juice into the salsa. Taste. Add more fish sauce and pepper, if needed.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Transfer the salsa to a bowl. Toss in the mango cubes. Let sit for a few minutes. Taste once more and adjust the seasonings. Depending on the level of sweetness of the mangoes, you may want to add more kaffir lime juice for balance. Sprinkle torn or roughly chopped cilantro leaves for garnish.
95caccd1-f2fa-4df6-bbda-0ef5ea45a49a
Serve the kaffir lime, onion, tomato and mango salsa with any grilled or fried meat, poultry or seafood.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
Rinse and scrub the pearl potatoes well. If more than one inch in diameter, you may want to cut them into halves or quarters. Place in a pan, cover with water, add the vinegar and about a teaspoon of salt. Bring to the boil. Lower the heat, cover and simmer until a skewer inserted at the center goes through with no resistance.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
While the potatoes cook, steam the corn. How long this process takes depends on the variety of corn you use. On the average, 20 to 30 minutes should be long enough.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
Drain the potatoes and transfer to a plate to cool.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
Take the corn off the steamer and cool.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
Roughly chop the red onion and bell pepper.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
Take the cooled ears of corn and cut off the kernels.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
Make the dressing. Place the butter and garlic in a microwaveable bowl. Heat on HIGH for 45 seconds to one minute or until the butter is fully melted. Stir in the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
Place the potatoes, corn kernels, red onion, bell pepper, scallions and dill in a bowl. Toss to distribute the ingredients evenly. Pour in the dressing and toss some more.
1ec44962-7c1f-4cc7-84b5-381d578a91ff
Allow the potato corn salad with lemon butter garlic dressing to sit on the counter for about ten minutes before serving.
02094f83-9bc4-422b-98a7-8f34a28318f4
7e736e24-1746-4419-a213-f055d5944cb3
d9bbf33f-6c40-4603-b9f5-76df56ffc823
7b585462-91ab-46ed-9c6d-d348f6d9662b
7b585462-91ab-46ed-9c6d-d348f6d9662b
21d79285-4b34-4e8c-9e03-8ff94f3c1c89
Cut the scallions into half-inch lengths.
21d79285-4b34-4e8c-9e03-8ff94f3c1c89
Peel and roughly chop the onion.
4e35556f-8413-450c-8da5-b36da57627fd
8f910c68-4fbe-4a76-8f6c-36966fe576cf
e43f278b-6216-4bdc-913e-c224ff9131f5
75eeeebb-03fd-44c6-a196-99c01cbcd595
d94187ba-a24e-4dcc-bcb6-9a190c229b49
cbd12011-da36-4ec1-acc1-e855d2e014ed
867586b5-0bfd-4e6e-952e-88cb7da8f15f
bf463f15-ce64-4f19-b601-398950cc38bc
f394258f-2f35-469a-8065-d319f1089667
In a wide pan, boil enough water to reach a depth of two inches. Sprinkle in the salt.
f394258f-2f35-469a-8065-d319f1089667
When the water boils, spread the asparagus in it and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
f394258f-2f35-469a-8065-d319f1089667
Drain the asparagus and dump in a bowl of iced water to keep them crisp.
f394258f-2f35-469a-8065-d319f1089667
In a small frying pan, melt the butter.
f394258f-2f35-469a-8065-d319f1089667
Over medium heat, fry the garlic in the butter until browned and crisp.
f394258f-2f35-469a-8065-d319f1089667
Arrange the asparagus on a plate. Pour the butter and garlic over them. Season with a little pepper.
9bfa5d80-0208-4711-bc9d-cbccb52ac870
92134c62-6c1b-4a51-b0f8-a5deea595f9e
Stir in the hot coffee.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
Heat a non-stick pan and spread the crumbled longganisa evenly. Cook over high heat for a few minutes to brown, stir to break up lumps and continue cooking until evenly browned.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
Strain the browned longganisa; save the rendered fat.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
Pour in four tablespoons of rendered longganisa fat and fold in. If you don't have enough rendered fat, add melted butter to whatever amount you have to make a total of four tablespoons.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
If you want to rest the batter (see notes after the recipe), cover the bowl and chill for 30 minutes.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
Stir the pancake batter a few times before you start to cook.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
Reheat the same pan in which you browned the crumbled longganisa.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
Pour in a teaspoon of rendered longganisa fat at the center of the pan.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
Pour in about 1/4 cup pancake batter and sprinkle about a tablespoon of browned longganisa on top.
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
When the edges of the surface of the pancake are covered with bubbles, flip using a spatula and cook the opposite side until lightly browned (for a detailed illustration, see the basic pancake recipe).
055089b3-6841-4bb0-9699-2bf4dde94356
Repeat until all the pancake batter is used up.
c4d9adb2-afb4-4b5c-8be3-88e37203520d
c130bf5c-b354-4f48-9e8c-288a7d566557
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Preheat the oven to 350F.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Brush the inside of two 9"x5" (or 8½"x4½") pans with butter. Optionally, line with baking paper (to make lifting the baked cake out of the pan easier).
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
In a large mixing bowl, mash the bananas until pasty.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Pour the melted butter over the mashed bananas and stir until incorporated.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Mix in the salt, baking soda, eggs, sugar and vanilla extract.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Mix in the flour.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Pour in the buttermilk and stir just until you get a uniform consistency
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Finally, stir in the nuts.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Pour the banana cake batter into the two prepared pans.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Bake the banana cake at 350F for 30 to 35 minutes.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Remove the cake pans from the oven, cool for five minutes and remove the cakes from the pans. Rest the banana cakes on a rack.
192dc415-51be-4ddb-8c42-0a64b3c44253
Cut the banana cakes into slices and serve. They're best while still warm.
9fdff312-2545-491d-a6f4-5e5690edd5d8
98c88fda-c69f-4e2f-b75a-2d3f8f12e7b0
98c88fda-c69f-4e2f-b75a-2d3f8f12e7b0
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Marinate the beef Cut the thinly-sliced beef into strips about half an inch wide.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Marinate the beef Place the meat in a bowl, add the garlic, pepper and seasoning. Mix well.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Marinate the beef Cover the bowl and let the meat marinate in the fridge overnight.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Cook the beef Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Cook the beef Spread the beef on the pan. Leave to sear for about two minutes then stir to break up lumps. Cook over high heat, stirring often, just until done. DO NOT OVERCOOK. Beef sliced so thinly should cook in about five minutes.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Season the noodles In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients for the noodle seasoning. Add the noodles and toss thoroughly.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Assemble the tapcitlog Divide the noodles among three bowls.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Assemble the tapcitlog Divide the cooked beef into three portions. Arrange over the noodles leaving the center hollow.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Assemble the tapcitlog Crack the soft boiled egg at the center of the bowl.
b07f27e8-7960-4c60-b1ba-d78da3d56e6a Assemble the tapcitlog Garnish the tapcitlog with sliced scallion before serving.
58cb2791-f053-454d-b434-7158901c430d
Spread the walnuts in an oil-free pan and sprinkle with salt. Toast, shaking the pan occasionally, until aromatic. Set aside.
58cb2791-f053-454d-b434-7158901c430d
Pour the milk into a sauce pan and crumble the cold rice directly into the milk. Add a generous pinch of salt.
58cb2791-f053-454d-b434-7158901c430d
Heat the milk and rice slowly, keeping the stove on the lowest setting.
58cb2791-f053-454d-b434-7158901c430d
When the milk and rice are simmering, add the dark chocolate and stir. Cook, still over low heat with occasional stirring, until the chocolate is completely melted.
58cb2791-f053-454d-b434-7158901c430d
Ladle the cooked champorado into four bowls. Sprinkle with milk chocolate morsels and salted toasted walnuts. Serve at once.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
Prepare the dough then cut and shape into buns after the first rising (both links contain step-by-step photos).
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
In a bowl, stir together the chopped corned beef, scallions and dehydrated onion.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
Take a piece of dough and flatten between your palms. Alternatively, use a rolling pin.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
Place a heaping tablespoonful of the corned beef mixture at the center of the flattened dough.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
Gather the edges of the dough to seal the filling. Roll in bread crumbs.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
Lay the filled dough on a baking tray with the seams tucked underneath. Make sure that they are at least two inches apart.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
Leave the filled dough to rise a second time for 30 to 45 minutes or until doubled.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
About 10 to 15 minutes before the second rising time is up, preheat the oven to 375F.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
Bake the corned beef pan de sal for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown on top.
0fcd6dea-c004-4843-a9d8-3b16d54c2cdc
Serve the corned beef pan de sal while hot.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Preheat the oven to 350F.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Line six holes of a muffin pan with paper liner.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Place the butter in a microwaveable bowl and sprinkle in the scallions.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Microwave the butter and scallions on HIGH for 15 to 20 seconds or just until the butter is melted. Alternatively, melt the butter gently on the stovetop.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Stir the dried onion into the melted butter. Set aside to cool.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and sugar.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Add the cheese cubes to the flour mixture and toss to coat each piece well. This will help prevent the cheese cubes from sinking to the bottom of the muffin pan during baking.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Take the cooled butter and pour in the milk. Add the egg. Mix until of uniform consistency.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Pour the butter-milk mixture into the flour-cheese mixture. Mix just until moistened. Ten to 12 turns are enough. DO NOT OVERMIX. Overmixing muffin batter results in tough muffins.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Spoon the muffin batter evenly among the six lined holes of the muffin pan.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Bake the muffins at 350F for 20 minutes.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Cool the muffins in the pan for about three minutes then transfer to a rack.
7a5e310d-16ca-4990-89ef-81b2476fc68b
Serve the onion and kesong puti breakfast muffins warm.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Preheat the oven to 400F.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Pierce the sausages and pop into a preheated 400F oven for 10 minutes or until cooked through and browned.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
While the sausages cook, make the salsa. Heat the butter in a sauce pan.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Saute the garlic, onion and oregano for a minute.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Add the carrot cubes and chopped bell peppers. Sprinkle in 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring, for half a minute.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Pour in the diced tomatoes.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Stir in the raisins and beans.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Bring the mixture to the boil, cover the pan and simmer for about 10 minutes.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Taste the salsa. Add more salt and pepper, if needed.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
Take the sausages out of the oven and add to the salsa. Stir gently. Cover the pot and braise for five minutes.
0468df3d-0a30-4b21-b5b1-a3fbd4b30bd1
To serve, arrange toasted bread and eggs on one side of the plate. Ladle the sausages and salsa on the opposite side. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and have a great breakfast.
ec67d78a-837b-4f43-a1e8-013c48c10c3e
Peel the cucumber.
ec67d78a-837b-4f43-a1e8-013c48c10c3e
Cut the peeled cucumber lengthwise and scrape off the seeds.
ec67d78a-837b-4f43-a1e8-013c48c10c3e
Dice the deseeded cucumber.
ec67d78a-837b-4f43-a1e8-013c48c10c3e
Place the diced cucumber in the blender with the ice cubes and a quarter cup of water. Process just until smooth.
ec67d78a-837b-4f43-a1e8-013c48c10c3e
Add the mint leaves and pulse two to three times.
ec67d78a-837b-4f43-a1e8-013c48c10c3e
Pour the cucumber cooler into a glass, garnish with a sprig of mint and enjoy!
be963feb-9b22-4a23-aa88-08dcf5a15bab
Lightly brush the inside of a 8"x4" loaf pan with oil. Sprinkle with flour and shake off the excess. Note that this step may not be necessary if using non-stick baking pans.
17b41f01-6f15-4506-80e1-2b2f90ca1e79
Set a pan over medium heat then spread the bacon in it. Cook over medium heat until browned (no, not all-the-way-crisp).
17b41f01-6f15-4506-80e1-2b2f90ca1e79
Scoop out the browned bacon, cut into smaller pieces (I used kitchen shears) and set aside.
17b41f01-6f15-4506-80e1-2b2f90ca1e79
Reheat two tablespoons of the bacon fat into a thick-bottomed fat.
17b41f01-6f15-4506-80e1-2b2f90ca1e79
Saute the onion, oregano and chili in the bacon fat.
17b41f01-6f15-4506-80e1-2b2f90ca1e79
When the onion bits are soft and translucent, pour in the baked beans and add back the bacon. Add the steak sauce, black pepper and paprika. Stir. Cook just until simmering.
17b41f01-6f15-4506-80e1-2b2f90ca1e79
Top the bacon and beans with sliced scallions before serving.
1b962d1f-ee2d-41cc-8518-9d7c8596f171
Rinse the potato and pat dry with paper towels. Peel (optional) and cut into 1/4-inch cubes.
1b962d1f-ee2d-41cc-8518-9d7c8596f171
Peel and chop the onion.
1b962d1f-ee2d-41cc-8518-9d7c8596f171
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan. Swirl the pan to coat the entire bottom with oil.
1b962d1f-ee2d-41cc-8518-9d7c8596f171
Fry the potato cubes over medium heat until golden and lightly crisp.
1b962d1f-ee2d-41cc-8518-9d7c8596f171
Add the chopped onion, sprinkle in some herb salt and cook, stirring often, until the potato bits are softened and translucent.
1b962d1f-ee2d-41cc-8518-9d7c8596f171
Add the corned beef. With a spatula, break up any lumps. Cook for a minute or two to give the potato cubes a chance to soak up the flavors of the seasoning and the meat.
1b962d1f-ee2d-41cc-8518-9d7c8596f171
Serve your corned beef hash with bread and, optionally, fried egg.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Lightly brush or spray the inside (bottom and sides) of two 8"x12" baking pans with oil. Sprinkle flour over the oil; tap off excess.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Sprinkle flour over your work surface.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Dump the dough on the floured work surface.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Cut the dough into four portions. Roll each portion into a log.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Take a log and pinch off into six equal chunks. Roll each chunk into a ball. Repeat with the three other logs.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Drop the dough balls into the prepared trays about two inches apart. Cover the trays loosely with cling film or cheesecloth and leave the dough to rise a second time, about 30 minutes.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Preheat the oven to 375F.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Place the butter and garlic in a microwave safe cup. Heat for 10 to 12 seconds or just until the butter melts. Stir.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Roughly chop the rosemary.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Remove the cover of the baking trays. Brush the dough balls liberally with the garlic butter mixture. Sprinkle the chopped rosemary evenly over all 24 rolls.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Bake the rolls at 375F for 20 to 25 minutes or until the tops are lightly browned.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Take the rolls out of the oven. While hot, brush with more garlic butter.
852c8e71-9afb-4538-84b8-7667eb06c149
Serve the rosemary and garlic dinner rolls while still warm.
20ce7f51-da72-4cc7-a46c-a686f62414da
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, honey, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg.
20ce7f51-da72-4cc7-a46c-a686f62414da
Set the stove to medium heat. Melt two to three tablespoons butter in a frying pan.
20ce7f51-da72-4cc7-a46c-a686f62414da
Dip (oh, please do not soak) both sides of three to five slices of baguette in the egg-milk mixture then fry in a single layer in the hot butter. Cook about a minute per side or just long enough to brown the bread. Repeat, adding more butter to the pan, until all the bread slices have been cooked.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Preheat the oven to 425F.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Line a baking tray with a silicone mat or non-stick paper. Sprinkle with corn meal.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
To make lifting the stuffed dough and moving it to the tray easier, cover your work surface with cling film sprinkled with corn meal.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Roll out the dough into a rectangle about a quarter of an inch thick.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Spread half of the cheddar on the dough to within two inches of the edges.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Arrange the pepperoni slices on top of the cheddar.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Sprinkle the chopped basil over the pepperoni followed by the sliced onion and roasted bell pepper.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Spread all of the mozzarella on top of the fillings. Scatter the remaining sharp cheddar over the mozzarella.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Brush all the edges of the dough with the beaten egg.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Fold in the edges.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Starting on one long side of the dough, roll the dough into a log.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Brush the top and sides of the log with more egg wash.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Lifting the cling film underneath the rolled dough, transfer the log to the prepared baking tray.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Using a sharp knife, create steam vents on the top of the log by making slashes about two inches apart.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Bake the stromboli at 425F for 10 minutes. Lower the heat to 375F and bake for another 10 minutes.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Take the stromboli out of the oven and transfer to a cutting board. When cool enough to handle, cut into slices.
6eab2ea7-cce7-4724-974d-8f4c9147abab
Serve the stromboli with tomato sauce for dipping.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Cut the sausages into rings about half an inch thick.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Slice the bacon into thin strips.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Peel and dice the onion.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Deseed and dice the bell peppers.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Cut the tomatoes into quarters or eighths, depending on how large or small they are.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Heat the olive oil in a pan. Add the bacon and sausages. Cook over medium-high heat until lightly browned.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Add the onion, oregano, thyme, and a bit of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring often, until the onion softens.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Throw in the bell peppers and tomatoes. Stir. Pour in the red wine. Set the heat to medium and allow everything to boil together for five to seven minutes or until the liquid is reduced by about half.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Set the heat to low. Cover the pan. Cook the sausages and vegetables for about 20 minutes or until the mixture is almost dry. Taste and add more salt and pepper, as needed.
2d6657d2-7505-4a7d-bb4b-d174370ca697
Serve the Italian-style sausages, bell peppers and onions with rice, bread, pasta or your carbs of choice.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Preheat the oven to 400F.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Mix together all the ingredients for the burgers. Place in a covered bowl and chill in the fridge while you prepare the rest of the components.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Peel the garlic. Cut off about a quarter off one end. Take the larger piece and rub the cut side on both sides of each of the baguette slices.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Arrange the baguette slices on a baking tray. Drizzle olive oil generously over them. Toast in a 400F oven for seven to eight minutes (or longer) just until crisp and lightly browned.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
While the bread slices toast, cook the burgers. Heat a heavy skillet (a cast iron pan works well) on the stovetop. High heat is essential here. Divide the burger mix into three portions. Form each portion into a ball then flatten. Less than half an inch thick is ideal.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Lay the patties on the hot skillet (make sure the skillet is already hot before laying the patties in it). Cook for two minutes on one side. Flip and cook for another minute to a minute and a half on the opposite side. Scoop out the burgers, move to a plate and give them a little rest.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Lower the heat. Into the skillet with the pan juices, pour in the beaten egg. Cook, stirring, just until set. Scoop out and transfer to a cutting board.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Take the bread out of the oven and arrange the toasted slices on a plate.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Mix the mayonnaise and Sriracha. Spread on the bread.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Arrange a few pieces of lettuce on top of the spicy mayo.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Lay a burger on top of the lettuce then top with a slice of tomato.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Cut the egg into three portions and lay a portion on each burger.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Pierce everything with a wooden skewer to keep them all in place.
ec5334ce-d843-4701-9c26-d2f88f62be6e
Serve the burger and egg canapés.
c531adcc-67c8-455e-9ad8-f3a1221bbc50
In a frying pan, heat the olive oil and butter together.
c531adcc-67c8-455e-9ad8-f3a1221bbc50
Add the mushrooms to the pan. Sprinkle with a little salt and pepper. Stir to coat each piece with oil. Over medium heat, cook the mushrooms with occasional stirring, until they start to caramelize and turn brown. It takes eight to ten minutes to get them to that stage.
c531adcc-67c8-455e-9ad8-f3a1221bbc50
Add the chick peas and green beans to the mushrooms. Sprinkle with a little more salt and pepper. Add the cayenne and paprika. Cook for two to three minutes or just until the green beans are starting to turn a bright green.
c531adcc-67c8-455e-9ad8-f3a1221bbc50
Stir in the lemon juice, balsamic vinegar and honey. Turn up the heat to high. Cook until the green beans are done (they should still be a little crisp) and the sauce has reduced and turned sticky. Taste and adjust the seasonings, as needed. Depending on your taste, you may want to add more lemon juice, salt or honey.
c531adcc-67c8-455e-9ad8-f3a1221bbc50
Serve your honey balsamic mushrooms, green beans and chick peas over rice or toasted bread. Garnish with shredded cheese (omit for a vegan meal) and chopped parsley.
9a599bff-2fbe-4fba-b465-bc6efd47be21
Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan.
9a599bff-2fbe-4fba-b465-bc6efd47be21
Lightly fry the tortilla on both sides. Drain on a rack while you prepare the rest of the components of your huevos rancheros.
9a599bff-2fbe-4fba-b465-bc6efd47be21
Into the remaining oil, crack the egg on one side of the frying pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. On the opposite side of the pan, scatter the chorizo slices. Cook until the egg is set and the chorizo slices are heated through.
9a599bff-2fbe-4fba-b465-bc6efd47be21
Assemble the dish. Lay lettuce leaves on a plate. Arrange the tortilla on top. Lay the egg on top of the tortilla. Spoon the chorizo slices, guacamole, jalapeño, corn and tomatoes around the egg.
9a599bff-2fbe-4fba-b465-bc6efd47be21
Drizzle lime or lemon juice over the chopped tomato and corn.
9a599bff-2fbe-4fba-b465-bc6efd47be21
Sprinkle in some torn cilantro or parsley. Serve.

2f44f8bb-4809-4a4a-9117-de5e7aacf957
Stir together the flour, salt, 2 tablespoons sugar and baking powder.
2f44f8bb-4809-4a4a-9117-de5e7aacf957
Toss the apple with 1 tablespoon sugar, and all of the cinnamon and nutmeg.
62fae2a7-d20a-42cb-80e2-bb6b4264cdf2
d1fe8013-d2e8-4207-a4c9-274a5707624d
1daa5b68-2942-460a-a17b-853f28b0d978
31f145a3-4c4b-4b03-a58d-ce8005501486
ffa12dbe-ef22-4c8f-be22-a82f8d068fed
To the flour mixture, add the grated cheese and scallions. Toss gently (I used my fingers) so as not to squish the cheese.
f2791ae8-6e53-474a-984a-46ed3c241f44
efa80808-761f-4e19-a2f9-aa3141f0c5eb
7a82a1e2-dea8-4c78-a53a-459a9a1f0cd7
74a22a59-2dea-4e23-accc-85f37b2fc788
05fccc44-8c0b-46c2-bc9a-37f1a7301187
Heat 1 tbsp. of cooking oil. Add the kailan tips, bok choy tips, carrot and bell pepper. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Stir fry for about a minute or until just done.
2c1503cc-122e-48ff-945e-54e405ff1af9
d639af4b-eaba-4044-b12b-79a3e894484f
10cf9365-9f01-4e49-844c-ba5a4d75a823

b6f233ea-d577-456b-8c6d-feb3b144c681
3f10a0e8-535d-473d-b56b-88ef7ee55afd
Garnish with sliced scallions and cilantro.
4a5229ef-b5be-4e1e-9cde-a9ca771a13f7

b3da25db-0487-4983-ab1b-27967300773f
99f4ab6a-d9df-418c-9f93-a38b8fded507
Heat enough cooking oil in a frying pan to reach a depth of at least two inches.
99f4ab6a-d9df-418c-9f93-a38b8fded507
When wisps of smoke start to float on the surface of the oil, fry the spring rolls. In batches, if your frying pan is not that large. Roll them in the hot oil for even browning.
5574686e-0c31-404e-aa18-3f94f1a82f3b
32b5db1c-e437-4912-b1a6-8bed233b9eb0
e9d49b79-e05d-4dc2-86da-3a084b1e424e
ad2480c8-bb35-48ee-8ddb-0ac6f7540efc
b4331a01-7c48-469d-8694-ac28d5b1982d
3e026fa8-b0c6-45de-b37f-9cfed7f8dcba
fad133c7-897a-4361-bb9e-feb8e58f76d2
3f1e6439-2192-40e9-a34b-e7c67766bda2
Pour a cup of milk into a mug. Add the tablea.
3f1e6439-2192-40e9-a34b-e7c67766bda2
Heat the milk in the microwave for a minute. This should moisten and soften the tablea a bit.
3f1e6439-2192-40e9-a34b-e7c67766bda2
Pour the contents of the mug into the blender, add the other cup of cold milk and about six ice cubes.
3f1e6439-2192-40e9-a34b-e7c67766bda2
Puree until smooth.
3f1e6439-2192-40e9-a34b-e7c67766bda2
Pour into a glass and enjoy your super rich milkshake.
91d517f7-1f41-4f14-8d1b-4121635f4735

1d6a6d04-77f5-460d-81dd-fc53acb71fc2
4e88008b-cfb5-48f1-bd40-c97f8fe9ebde
5af17443-cf44-405f-bcd4-7980cb098de1

5314cc8a-4dda-4446-be07-5accce456339
ed06f1df-5a23-4ccb-b8ff-2f8ebb3fe138
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
If your pork chops are thicker than half an inch, lay them on a flat surface and pound with a mallet until they are about half an inch thick.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Pat the pork chops dry with paper towels.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Rub Cajun spice mix evenly on both sides of the pork chops.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Place the seasoned pork chops in a covered container and leave to marinate overnight in the fridge.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Place the flour in a shallow bowl.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Beat the egg in another shallow bowl.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Spread the panko in a third shallow bowl.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Dredge each pork chop in flour (shake off the excess), dip in egg (make sure every inch of the surface is covered) then roll in panko.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least two inches. Keep the heat on medium low.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Fry the pork chops on both sides (three to four minutes per side), flipping them midway through the cooking.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Remove the cooked pork chops from the oil and rest on a rack.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Lay the bottom halves of the buns on plates and line with shredded lettuce.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Place a pork chop on each of the lettuce-line bottom halves of the buns.
51309a6b-aac4-4c4e-9ccf-852a68cdf7df
Drizzle gravy over the chops and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds before placing the top halves of the buns in place.
dd25d38b-bca8-4a60-a028-2d73188e73f1
dd25d38b-bca8-4a60-a028-2d73188e73f1
dd25d38b-bca8-4a60-a028-2d73188e73f1
47140e90-968e-4ee4-9618-94e78b6f6bf9
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Cut the beef into thin strips. Place in a bowl, add 2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper. Mix and set aside.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Cut the lettuce into strips, rinse and pass through a salad spinner to remove excess water. Set aside.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
In a bowl, beat the eggs with two pinches of salt and a pinch of pepper.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Heat a frying pan and coat the bottom with cooking oil.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
When the oil in hot, pour in the beaten eggs and cook just until the edges are set. Fold the omelet into thirds, flip and cook for another 30 seconds.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Slide the omelet onto a plate and set aside.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Reheat the frying pan and drizzle in two tablespoons of oil.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
When the oil starts to smoke, spread the seasoned beef strips to cover the entire bottom. Cook over high heat without disturbing for about two minutes to allow a light crust to form.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Flip the beef, cook for a minute again without disturbing then stir. Continue cooking until the edges of the beef strips are lightly crisp.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Lay three slices of bread side by side and top each with lettuce.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Divide the omelet into three equal portions and lay on top of the bed of lettuce.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Pile the beef tapa on top of the egg and sprinkle with fried garlic.
d3936316-4d0c-4e32-bbec-21f65758788b
Serve the beef tapa sandwiches immediately or wrap to carry to your picnic.
c90bf91f-57bc-4628-b9b2-f5ccde17eb10
Place chicken, bell peppers, celery, carrot, onion, pickle relish and parsley in a bowl. Stir to distribute the ingredients evenly.
c90bf91f-57bc-4628-b9b2-f5ccde17eb10
In another bowl, whisk the cream cheese until light and fluffy. Stir in the mayonnaise. Fold in the cheddar.
c90bf91f-57bc-4628-b9b2-f5ccde17eb10
Scrape the mayo-cheese mixture into the bowl with the chicken and vegetables. Mix lightly but thoroughly to moisten all the dry ingredients.
c90bf91f-57bc-4628-b9b2-f5ccde17eb10
Taste the sandwich filling. Add salt and pepper to balance the flavors.
c90bf91f-57bc-4628-b9b2-f5ccde17eb10
Cover the bowl and chill for at least two hours.
c90bf91f-57bc-4628-b9b2-f5ccde17eb10
Taste the sandwich filling again. You'll be surprised how the flavors have mellowed and blended. You may need to add more salt and pepper.
c90bf91f-57bc-4628-b9b2-f5ccde17eb10
Take a slice of toast. Pile on the chicken sandwich filling. Top with lettuce leaves and cover with another slice of toast.
e9b3a9bb-4a39-437f-85bd-7f38065b3567
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
Start heating a skillet on the stove.
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
Place the chicken thigh fillets between sheets of cling film and pound to a uniform thickness. One-fourth inch thickness is ideal for quick cooking. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, cayenne, garlic powder and onion powder.
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
Place the seasoned chicken on the pre-heated skillet and cook over high heat for two minutes per side.
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
While the chicken cooks, prepare the garnishes. In this case, the "garnishes" were prepared in the form of a simple salad. Shred the lettuce. Halve the cherry tomatoes. Peel, de-seed and cut the cucumber into small cubes. Toss them all together with the scallions in a bowl. Drizzle in enough vinaigrette to moisten them and toss once more.
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
Take the chicken off the skillet and transfer to a chopping board.
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
Warm the tortilla on both sides in the still hot skillet.
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
Slice or chop the chicken.
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
Place the warmed tortilla on a plate. Spoon the salad on the tortilla, top with the grilled chicken and sprinkle in some torn cilantro.
9950b1c2-5baa-480e-acee-6bbc2061ece3
Enjoy your chicken fajita!
8f7d64d2-8365-49f6-9710-4795b50ea9ab
48c658af-6a5f-413c-af31-54ed086c0029

d208a7a1-631c-401e-bdec-e97d87e208e2
ec86d266-df31-450f-957e-6bf761b387fc
So, that’s how the bottom of the tortilla looks like at serving time. To eat it, just fold and bite.
ae767550-2407-434a-933b-4d5dd50fedcf
1075438f-40a2-4632-b1e4-512af3c9c80c
f794effe-8665-4f77-bc89-5d7c4661bc4e
f79d314d-61fb-4af0-88c1-2c19bba89115
Mix together all the ingredients for the burgers. Form the mixture into four patties. Chill while you prepare the shoestring potatoes.
f79d314d-61fb-4af0-88c1-2c19bba89115
Julienne the potatoes. Dump into a bowl of salted water.
f79d314d-61fb-4af0-88c1-2c19bba89115
Grill or broil the burgers, three to four minutes per side. Transfer to a plate, cover loosely with foil and allow to rest.
f79d314d-61fb-4af0-88c1-2c19bba89115
Heat the cooking oil to smoking point in a frying pan.
f79d314d-61fb-4af0-88c1-2c19bba89115
Drain the julienned potatoes and spread on a kitchen towel to remove excess water.
f79d314d-61fb-4af0-88c1-2c19bba89115
Fry the julienned potatoes in hot oil until browned and crisp. Scoop out the crisp potatoes and drain on a stack of paper towels (or dump in a strainer). Sprinkle with a little salt and toss.
882972db-f879-4342-b6b9-39d4ce79744f
b87148ad-98fe-42b4-bdde-eea4d41e9fb9
7cfbf59a-306d-4e1e-b111-512be59bbdde

0efe8b7f-1379-4c86-9582-8cd7e50a13c5
In a wok or frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of at least three inches. The temperature should be before it starts to smoke. Sorry, I don’t use kitchen thermometers. You can test the temperature by dropping a small piece of bread into the hot oil. If the bread browns too fast, the oil is too hot.
0efe8b7f-1379-4c86-9582-8cd7e50a13c5
Holding a clubhouse sandwich securely in your hands, roll all sides in the beaten eggs. Then dredge all sides in bread crumbs.
0efe8b7f-1379-4c86-9582-8cd7e50a13c5
With kitchen tongs, lower the sandwich in hot oil. The sandwich will not sink so you will need to turn it over after a few seconds to brown the other side. The frying part should not take more than a few seconds since you don’t want the oil to reach the insides of the sandwich; you just want to brown the outside.
0efe8b7f-1379-4c86-9582-8cd7e50a13c5
As soon as lightly browned, carefully lift the sandwich from the hot oil with kitchen tongs and drain on lots of paper towels.
ee8fb700-a508-437e-ac48-4d0fc9ff6796
Stir in the hot coffee.
a2352b69-dee2-41e5-a1f4-232521d769bd
3d32d89c-d772-464a-8467-92b72a068402
743c0b92-1594-44c3-9733-c6492620db25
25ae086f-4d7e-4eb8-a4b1-eca004b04a2d
Prepare the gelatin according to package directions but reduce the amount of water by about 1/5 for a firmer jelly. Stir in the coffee (and sugar, if using unsweetened gelatin).
25ae086f-4d7e-4eb8-a4b1-eca004b04a2d
Divide the jelly among three tall glasses. Fill glasses with very cold milk. Serve the coffee jelly beverage at once.
a2b4731b-0023-4a6c-bd63-ccf499f644a6
Dump the dried rose buds into a heatproof bowl.
a2b4731b-0023-4a6c-bd63-ccf499f644a6
Pour in two cups of hot water. How hot? Okay, boil the water then turn off the heat and leave for five minutes. Then, pour the hot water over the rose buds.
a2b4731b-0023-4a6c-bd63-ccf499f644a6
Cover the bowl loosely and leave to infuse for 30 minutes or until the liquid is cool.
a2b4731b-0023-4a6c-bd63-ccf499f644a6
Pour the infusion (optionally, you may strain it at this point) into a pitcher and add two cups of ice cubes.
a2b4731b-0023-4a6c-bd63-ccf499f644a6
Add the lemon slices, if using, to the infusion and stir in as much honey as you like.
a2b4731b-0023-4a6c-bd63-ccf499f644a6
Serve at once.
0978f2ca-1a22-45fa-8844-125dfd2fe2a6
Peel the cucumber.
0978f2ca-1a22-45fa-8844-125dfd2fe2a6
Cut the peeled cucumber lengthwise and scrape off the seeds.
0978f2ca-1a22-45fa-8844-125dfd2fe2a6
Dice the deseeded cucumber.
0978f2ca-1a22-45fa-8844-125dfd2fe2a6
Place the diced cucumber in the blender with the ice cubes and a quarter cup of water. Process just until smooth.
0978f2ca-1a22-45fa-8844-125dfd2fe2a6
Add the mint leaves and pulse two to three times.
0978f2ca-1a22-45fa-8844-125dfd2fe2a6
Pour the cucumber cooler into a glass, garnish with a sprig of mint and enjoy!
c47b4b91-258b-4bd7-ab10-db8f1ac5243a
Prepare four glasses.
c47b4b91-258b-4bd7-ab10-db8f1ac5243a
Stir together the grapefruit juice, pineapple juice and coconut rum in a pitcher.
c47b4b91-258b-4bd7-ab10-db8f1ac5243a
Drop three to four ice cubes into each glass.
c47b4b91-258b-4bd7-ab10-db8f1ac5243a
Divide the grapefruit-pineapple-rum mixture among the four glasses.
c47b4b91-258b-4bd7-ab10-db8f1ac5243a
Drop in a pineapple or grapefruit slice or wedge into each glass.
c47b4b91-258b-4bd7-ab10-db8f1ac5243a
Serve at once.
c3d8b164-7975-4892-8497-f5626ebc58c7
Cut the watermelon, honeydew and cantaloupe into halves. Scoop out the seeds of the honeydew and cantaloupe.
c3d8b164-7975-4892-8497-f5626ebc58c7
Using a baller, scoop out as many balls as you can from the flesh of the three fruits.
c3d8b164-7975-4892-8497-f5626ebc58c7
Place the melon balls in a shallow container wide enough to hold them in a single layer. Pour the vodka over them. Cover the container tightly and freeze the melon balls overnight. They should be rock hard.
c3d8b164-7975-4892-8497-f5626ebc58c7
Dump the frozen melon balls into a punch bowl (or into individual glasses) including the pool of frozen vodka that has formed between them.
c3d8b164-7975-4892-8497-f5626ebc58c7
Stir the pineapple juice and sugar until the sugar is completely dissolved.
c3d8b164-7975-4892-8497-f5626ebc58c7
Pour the pineapple juice over the frozen melon balls.
c3d8b164-7975-4892-8497-f5626ebc58c7
IMPORTANT: Leave to allow the melon balls to partially thaw for about ten minutes before serving. If not serving immediately, keep in the fridge until needed. If the tipsy melon balls is kept in the fridge for an hour or longer, serve as soon as you take them out of the fridge.
c7df8d70-e01b-4ea2-8f56-c99d1532a948
Peel the kiwi and dice.
c7df8d70-e01b-4ea2-8f56-c99d1532a948
Put the diced kiwi in the blender. Pour in the rest of the ingredients and two ice cubes.
c7df8d70-e01b-4ea2-8f56-c99d1532a948
Process the fruit, liquids and ice until smooth.
c7df8d70-e01b-4ea2-8f56-c99d1532a948
Pour the kiwi daiquiri into a glass and serve.
49fd60e1-9e1b-48fe-8aaa-d038c20285fa

5e206551-5686-4e53-bdfb-01dad40e34d3
7a70b123-c5c3-4aba-93bb-a48fcf4d60ce
(For best results, allow to steep in the fridge for at least six hours; overnight is better).
bf4a926b-9c81-40d1-b8e6-aaa8df48555e
