4e101072-7abc-40dc-ad11-47039c61968d
Pour all the ingredients into a pitcher or carafe. DO NOT add ice at this point. Stir.
4e101072-7abc-40dc-ad11-47039c61968d
Add ice to the mixed drink and pour into chilled glasses.
4e101072-7abc-40dc-ad11-47039c61968d
Optionally, you can skip adding ice after mixing the drink and drop a few ice cubes directly into each glass before pouring in the drink.
4e101072-7abc-40dc-ad11-47039c61968d
Serve the amaretto, cranberry and orange cocktail immediately.
28e905c6-6c71-4031-a7e7-86b47d80a8da
Stir the sugar into the coffee until dissolved.
28e905c6-6c71-4031-a7e7-86b47d80a8da
Stir in the milk, cream or non-dairy creamer.
28e905c6-6c71-4031-a7e7-86b47d80a8da
Place ice cubes in a tall glass, about three-fourths full.
28e905c6-6c71-4031-a7e7-86b47d80a8da
Pour the coffee into the glass. Stir. Serve.
d1ecee73-d964-405a-8055-56d305bcabe0
Pour a cup of milk into a mug. Add the tablea.
d1ecee73-d964-405a-8055-56d305bcabe0
Heat the milk in the microwave for a minute. This should moisten and soften the tablea a bit.
d1ecee73-d964-405a-8055-56d305bcabe0
Pour the contents of the mug into the blender, add the other cup of cold milk and about six ice cubes.
d1ecee73-d964-405a-8055-56d305bcabe0
Puree until smooth.
d1ecee73-d964-405a-8055-56d305bcabe0
Pour into a glass and enjoy your super rich milkshake.
74c89efc-fd6a-4753-a045-d7dda1b30789
e6bdd68b-ecef-481a-beed-4e6e7ad72eb3
0cbe1aab-4eec-497b-b46c-9c46f8f398fd
Squeeze the juices of the oranges and lemon. Use a citrus juicer, if you have to, to get as much of the pulps as possible. Just remember that when using a citrus juicer, don’t overdo the squeezing because if you squeeze the pith of the fruits, the bitter taste of the pith will get mixed in with the juice.
0cbe1aab-4eec-497b-b46c-9c46f8f398fd
Pour the juices into glasses (or a pitcher). Add twice as much water.
0cbe1aab-4eec-497b-b46c-9c46f8f398fd
Add sugar. Mix to dissolve the sugar.
0cbe1aab-4eec-497b-b46c-9c46f8f398fd
Add ice and serve.
b22cb2af-a8bf-43b9-b102-1277361af8f1
9806da36-3ee0-48eb-9cd6-079b164dc6b7
3e5ee3ec-731f-4f99-b33a-69972bb43bde
Add ice and shake.
3e5ee3ec-731f-4f99-b33a-69972bb43bde
Pour into a martini glass and serve at once.
4ccffd24-57e4-409a-a063-913068097aca
4d169be1-3d45-4004-86c3-c5c2b7183e35
337da9b4-e027-4816-b3e8-0b42c2cd8101
e64d4623-70cc-4b32-b61d-0f61e03eea51
e52ea7f2-9303-4a20-a9f3-3b409ed10937
42596224-4aa7-4e4a-a48a-af2cc0bcfafd
d30c229f-3636-4371-9004-7f614d0a8c9b
ae407c6c-15b7-4894-a27c-fefa7c3878b8
2feec4a0-8911-4258-bd8e-5ad0f1fce79e
ce0fc3f5-fe5f-4791-addb-1817ee5d564d
06e2073d-0ad0-41e5-a522-176d7819ed5d
83697ffc-86f1-4937-88cb-1351dc766056
150b8e8b-6c47-4d57-ba43-19e5adfcd941
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Soak the sotanghon and wood ear mushrooms in hot water in separate bowls.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Stir the annatto powder and oil, and pour into a sauce pan, and turn on the heat.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Lay the chicken fillets, skin side down, in the oil and cook medium-high heat for a minute or two to render fat from the skin. Flip and cook for another minute.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Pour in the broth. Season with patis and pepper.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Bring to the boil.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Dump the cabbage and carrot into the pan.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Drain the sotanghon and add to the vegetables in the pan.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Drain the wood ear mushrooms, trim, slice and add to the sotanghon and vegetables.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Simmer everything together for five minutes.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Taste the broth and add more patis, if needed.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Scoop out the chicken and move to a cutting board.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Cut the chicken into strips and put back in the pan.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
Simmer the chicken sotanghon soup for another five to seven minutes.
78926e1a-4d82-4cc3-81e9-3ca4223de5f9
To serve, ladle the chicken sotanghon soup into bowls and sprinkle with sliced scallions and fried garlic.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Peel and finely mince the garlic.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Peel and finely slice the onion.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Peel the carrot and slice thinly.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Cut off the leaves of the Chinese cabbage and reserve for future use. You only need the crisp stalks for this noodle dish. Cut the stalks into one-inch lengths.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Discard the root ends of the scallions and cut into one-inch lengths.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Cut the fish balls into halves.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Slice the kikiam diagonally into two to three pieces.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Heat the cooking oil. Lightly fry the fish balls and kikiam.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Add the carrots and cook, stirring, for about a minute. Add the garlic, onion and Chinese cabbage stalks; cook for another minute. Add the onion leaves. Stir.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Pour in the soy sauce, oyster sauce and hoisin sauce. Add pepper. Stir to blend.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Add the noodles, toss and stir to coat the noodles with the sauce.
86d5474f-98a8-4ea8-ac25-414216194e04
Turn off the heat, drizzle with sesame oil and serve.
21e56703-5753-47d6-88f4-e5dca659f4a0
While the spaghetti cooks, make the sauce. Heat the olive oil in a large pot.
21e56703-5753-47d6-88f4-e5dca659f4a0
Over medium heat, cook the chopped onion with a lot of stirring, until translucent.
21e56703-5753-47d6-88f4-e5dca659f4a0
Add the hotdogs, sausages and chorizos. Cook, stirring, for about a minute.
21e56703-5753-47d6-88f4-e5dca659f4a0
Pour in the diced tomatoes. Season with a little salt and lots of freshly ground pepper. Bring to the boil, cover and simmer.
21e56703-5753-47d6-88f4-e5dca659f4a0
When the spaghetti is almost done (not quite al dente but undercooked a bit more), drain and add to the sauce.
21e56703-5753-47d6-88f4-e5dca659f4a0
Add half of the sliced basil leaves. Toss well and let the spaghetti finish cooking in the sauce.
5f081d6a-6aba-4ecb-b214-bd6318f3f0ba
f8de1da3-2999-409d-a249-a6348be9689e
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Place the bihon in a bowl and pour in enough hot water to cover. Leave for at least 20 minutes to soften. Drain well.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Blanch the miki in boiling water, drain, rinse under the tap and drain again.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Place the pork in a pan and cover with water. Boil for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse. Discard the cooking liquid.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Clean out the pan and put the pork back in. Cover with clean water. Add a tablespoon of salt and a quarter teaspoon of pepper. Bring to the boil, cover the pan, lower the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Drain well.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Heat two tablespoons of cooking oil in a frying pan. Add the drained pork and pan fry until lightly browned.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Add half of the garlic and shallots to the pork. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for about a minute.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Turn up the heat. Add the carrot, green beans and cabbage to the pork. Cook, tossing and stirring, for half a minute. Drizzle in a tablespoon of fish sauce. Continue cooking, stirring often, for another three to four minutes. Taste. Add more fish sauce, if too bland for you. DO NOT overcook the vegetables.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Scoop out the contents of the frying pan and set aside.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Pour in the remaining cooking oil and heat.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Saute the remaining garlic and shallots in the hot oil.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Add the drained bihon and miki to the garlic and shallots. Toss a few times.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Drizzle in the soy sauce. Keep tossing and stirring until the noodles are hot and evenly colored.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Add the pork and vegetables to the noodles. Stir well to distribute evenly. Cook for another minute to allow the flavors to blend.
fb2c5729-9af2-418d-bd6b-664ee4a33b33
Serve your pancit miki bihon with kalamansi halves (or lime or lemon wedges) on the side.
d9b2bf12-40b3-4835-96ce-777dbce38ca1
Lower the heat to medium. Add the dried shrimps, shallot, garlic, ginger and chilies. Saute until the mixture is almost dry.
d9b2bf12-40b3-4835-96ce-777dbce38ca1
Add the taro leaves. Pour in a cup of coconut milk. Drizzle in fish sauce. Bring to a gentle boil, pushing down the taro leaves to submerge in the liquid.
d9b2bf12-40b3-4835-96ce-777dbce38ca1
The laing is cooked at this point but very strongly flavored. Add the full cream milk, stirring it in, to make the flavors milder and to thin out the laing so it is easier to toss with the pasta.
d9b2bf12-40b3-4835-96ce-777dbce38ca1
Off the heat, take the cooked spaghetti and add to the laing. Toss until blended.
d9b2bf12-40b3-4835-96ce-777dbce38ca1
Ladle the laing spaghetti into bowls. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan and, optionally, sliced bird's eye chilies, before serving.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Boil plenty of water in a pot. Throw in a heaping tablespoonful of salt. Cook the pasta al dente.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
While the pasta boils, spread the bacon in a hot frying pan. Cook until browned and fat has been rendered. Scoop out and set aside.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Pour off the bacon fat leaving two tablespoonfuls in the frying pan. Add the olive oil and heat.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Cook the garlic in the hot oil over medium heat just until starting to brown.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Throw the asparagus into the hot oil, sprinkle with salt and cook for about two minutes.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Stir in the shrimps, sprinkle in more salt, add pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, for about two minutes or just until the shrimps are done (see notes after the recipe).
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Drain the pasta (reserve a quarter cup of the cooking liquid) and dump into the frying pan.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Pour in the pasta liquid. Cook, tossing everything together, for another minute.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Off the heat, add the bacon to the pasta and toss a few more times.
6d29693a-cae3-4f7b-a18d-4cb063581ded
Serve the bacon, shrimps and asparagus spaghetti with Parmesan.
085fdd39-e8d1-43a8-92dd-6c585a28f921
In a frying pan, heat enough cooking to reach a depth of ¼ inch.
085fdd39-e8d1-43a8-92dd-6c585a28f921
Mince the tocino and cook over medium-low heat until the sugar in the marinade has caramelized (the meat will be fully done at that point).
085fdd39-e8d1-43a8-92dd-6c585a28f921
While the tocino cooks, drain the achara. Save the liquid.
085fdd39-e8d1-43a8-92dd-6c585a28f921
Drizzle the achara liquid over the noodles and toss well.
085fdd39-e8d1-43a8-92dd-6c585a28f921
Divide the cooked noodles among four shallow bowls.
085fdd39-e8d1-43a8-92dd-6c585a28f921
Divide the cooked tocino into three portions and spread over the noodles.
085fdd39-e8d1-43a8-92dd-6c585a28f921
Top the tocino with achara and scallions.
085fdd39-e8d1-43a8-92dd-6c585a28f921
Arrange egg halves on the side of each bowl before serving your tocitlog.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Marinate the beef Cut the thinly-sliced beef into strips about half an inch wide.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Marinate the beef Place the meat in a bowl, add the garlic, pepper and seasoning. Mix well.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Marinate the beef Cover the bowl and let the meat marinate in the fridge overnight.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Cook the beef Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Cook the beef Spread the beef on the pan. Leave to sear for about two minutes then stir to break up lumps. Cook over high heat, stirring often, just until done. DO NOT OVERCOOK. Beef sliced so thinly should cook in about five minutes.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Season the noodles In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients for the noodle seasoning. Add the noodles and toss thoroughly.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Assemble the tapcitlog Divide the noodles among three bowls.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Assemble the tapcitlog Divide the cooked beef into three portions. Arrange over the noodles leaving the center hollow.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Assemble the tapcitlog Crack the soft boiled egg at the center of the bowl.
ef4bb295-0ae5-446f-97e8-38155281ef27 Assemble the tapcitlog Garnish the tapcitlog with sliced scallion before serving.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Using a mallet, pound the chicken fillets to a uniform thickness of about a quarter inch.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Sprinkle the chicken fillets generously with salt and pepper.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Place the flour in a shallow bowl. Beat the egg in another shallow bowl. Dump the panko in a third shallow bowl.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Dredge each chicken fillet in flour, dip in egg then coat with panko.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Preheat the oven to 450F.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
In a frying pan, heat enough cooking oil to reach a depth of one inch.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Fry the chicken fillets, in batches if necessary, until the coating is golden and crisp, about three to four minutes per side.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Scoop out the fried chicken fillets and arrange on a baking tray lined with foil, non-stick paper or silicone mat.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Spread a tablespoonful or two of tomato sauce on each chicken fillet.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Sprinkle Parmesan generously on top of the tomato sauce.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Lay a slice of mozzarella on top of the Parmesan.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Bake the chicken fillets for a minute or two, or just until the cheeses are melted.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Reheat the tomato sauce and toss in the angel hair pasta.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Heap pasta into bowls and top with the baked chicken.
93a45fbf-176e-4ee2-8ecd-1d101d40a6d5
Serve the chicken Parmigiana with angel hair pasta immediately.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Pat the pork belly dry with paper towels.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Heat the cooking oil in a shallow pan.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Sear all sides of the pork belly in hot oil until browned.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Pour in the soy sauce, rice wine and bone broth. Bring to the boil and cook, uncovered, for about five minutes.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Stir in the sugar, ginger, garlic, five-spice powder and hoisin sauce. Lower the heat, cover the pan tightly and simmer for an hour to an hour and half, turning the pork belly halfway through the cooking.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Preheat the oven to 350F.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Transfer the pork belly to a baking dish.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Boil the sauce, uncovered, until thick and reduced to about a quarter cup.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Brush the reduced sauce all over the pork belly.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Cook the pork Bake the pork belly in a preheated 350F oven for 10 to 15 minutes or just until the glaze caramelizes. Remove from the oven and cool slightly.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Blanch the bok choy Rinse the bok choy well. DO NOT separate the stalks. Just make sure there is no soil hiding between them.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Blanch the bok choy Boil about four cups water with one teaspoon salt in a shallow pan.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Blanch the bok choy Cook the bok choy in the salted water for about five minutes. Scoop out, drain and set aside.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Stir fry the noodles Throw out the salted water and pour another four cups into the pan. Bring to the boil.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Stir fry the noodles Cook the dried egg noodles just until done. DO NOT allow to get soggy.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Stir fry the noodles Drain the noodles. Dump in a bowl of iced water and leave for a minute until the noodles are cold. This stabilizes the starch to allow the noodles to be stir fried without sticking to one another. Drain well.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Stir fry the noodles Heat the sesame seed oil in a wok or frying pan. Stir fry the egg noodles to coat every strand with oil.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Stir fry the noodles Pour in the soy sauce and hoisin sauce. Stir fry until the coloring is even.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Assemble the dish Arrange the blanched bok choy on the sides of a platter.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Assemble the dish Spread the noodles to fill the plate.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Assemble the dish Cut the pork belly into one-fourth inch sliced and arrange on top of the noodles.
f0592c19-612b-4c74-a002-c53c2be14be2 Assemble the dish Serve the five-spice braised pork belly with noodles and bok choy immediately.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Remove the heads, shell and devein the shrimps. Place in a bowl, sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Heat one tablespoon oil in a wok or frying pan. Over medium heat, saute the garlic and onion until softened and aromatic, about two minutes.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Turn up the heat. Add the bell pepper, carrot, cabbage and mushrooms. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Stir fry until the vegetables are cooked but still lightly crisp, about two minutes. Scoop out the vegetables and transfer to a plate.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Pour in another tablespoon of oil into the wok or frying pan and heat.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Stir fry the seasoned shrimps taking care not to overcook them. Depending on their size, this can take anywhere from a mere thirty seconds to a minute and a half. Scoop out the shrimps and transfer to a plate.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Pour the last tablespoon of oil into the wok or frying pan. Swirl the pan around to allow the oil to coat the sides too.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Dump the noodles in the hot oil and, working fast, stir fry to coat every strand with oil. This will prevent them from turning soggy.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Pour the soy sauce, oyster sauce and hoisin sauce over the noodles. Stir fry until the noodles are evenly colored.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Add the vegetables and quail eggs to the noodles and stir fry until everything is heated through.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Turn off the heat. Drizzle in the sesame seed oil and toss.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Taste the stir fried noodles and vegetables. Adjust the seasonings if needed.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Scatter the cooked shrimps over the stir fried vegetables and noodles.
c9c39599-cc91-4731-8072-a49dc04ad88d
Serve the shrimp chow mein at once.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Preheat the oven to 325F.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
In a bowl, mix together the chopped spinach and cream cheese until smooth.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Spoon the spinach-cream cheese mixture into a piping bag and pipe into the uncooked cannelloni. Make sure that they are filled from end to end.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Spread the tomato sauce on the entire bottom of a baking dish.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Arrange the stuffed cannelloni in a single layer on top of the sauce making sure they are not packed together too tightly. They need a little room to expand.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Spread the tomato meat sauce over the cannelloni.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Cover the baking dish tightly with foil.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Bake the spinach and cream cheese stuffed cannelloni with meat sauce at 325F for about 50 minutes.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Take the baking dish out of the oven.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Turn up the oven temperature to 400F.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Peel off the foil covering the baking dish and discard.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Sprinkle the shredded cheese on top of the tomato meat sauce.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Return the cannelloni into the oven and bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
3ce36677-6aa6-4708-af55-cba170fab65c
Let the cannelloni rest for about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Cut the pork belly into half inch slices. Cut each slice into strips less than half an inch wide.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Place the pork belly in a bowl. Add the soy sauce, rice wine and half of the garlic. Mix well. Cover the bowl and let the pork marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Peel the carrot and julienne.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Core and deseed the bell pepper and julienne as well.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Pinch off the tips of the chicharo and pull of the stringy fiber along the sides.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Thinly slice the cabbage.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Peel the shallot and thinly slice.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Heat the wok and pour in a tablespoon of oil.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Stir fry the pork in the hot oil until cooked through. Because the pork had been cut into small pieces and because stir frying requires extremely high heat, the pork should be done in less than five minutes. Scoop them out and transfer to a bowl.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Heat the remaining cooking oil in the wok. Stir fry the carrot, bell pepper, chicharo and cabbage with generous pinches of salt and pepper just until softened, about 15 seconds.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Add the sliced shallot and remaining garlic to the vegetables in the wok and stir fry for another 15 seconds. Scoop out and spread on a plate to cool them to stop the cooking immediately.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
In a bowl, mix together all the ingredients for the sauce and pour into the wok. Cook, stirring often, until thickened and no longer cloudy in appearance. Don’t worry if it doesn’t look too thick. It shouldn’t be. Slightly thickened is the ideal texture — just thick enough to coat the noodles but not make them stick together as they cool.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Taste the sauce. Add salt and pepper, if needed (you may need to if your broth is unseasoned or underseasoned).
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Add the noodles to the sauce and toss thoroughly. Cook until heated through.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Throw in the cooked vegetables and quail eggs. Toss well.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Add the cooked pork to the noodles and vegetables. Toss to distribute evenly.
8c884bb0-e570-4991-b6d5-07e6158599b6
Serve the pancit canton at once.
ee2100cc-78bb-46be-8d6a-6cb0cd732e92
Cook the pasta in boiling salted water.
ee2100cc-78bb-46be-8d6a-6cb0cd732e92
While the pasta cooks, make the sauce. Melt the butter. Saute the garlic, onion and oregano with generous pinches of salt and pepper.
ee2100cc-78bb-46be-8d6a-6cb0cd732e92
When the onion bits are soft, pour in the contents of the can of tomatoes, crushing the tomatoes with your hand. Boil gently, uncovered, to reduce until the pasta is done.
ee2100cc-78bb-46be-8d6a-6cb0cd732e92
Break up the sardines. Stir half into the sauce.
ee2100cc-78bb-46be-8d6a-6cb0cd732e92
Pour in as much of the oil from the jar of sardines as you wish into the sauce. Stir. Taste. Add salt and pepper, as needed.
ee2100cc-78bb-46be-8d6a-6cb0cd732e92
Toss the pasta into the sauce.
ee2100cc-78bb-46be-8d6a-6cb0cd732e92
Ladle the pasta into bowls. Garnish with the remaining sardines and, optionally, with grated Parmesan and finely sliced scallions.
23e94b4d-7aa8-41ae-aa1e-c536e1a1b9b1 Marinate the beef Thinly slice the beef (less than 1/4 inch thick is ideal) then cut into strips about half an inch wide. Place in a bowl.
23e94b4d-7aa8-41ae-aa1e-c536e1a1b9b1 Marinate the beef Stir together the soy sauce, rice wine and baking soda. Pour over the beef. Mix well. Cover the bowl and marinate in the fridge for at least an hour.
23e94b4d-7aa8-41ae-aa1e-c536e1a1b9b1 Make the sauce Pour the broth into a small sauce pan. Add the star anise, bay leaf, ginger, garlic, peppercorns, soy sauce and sugar. Bring to the boil, cover, lower the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes.
23e94b4d-7aa8-41ae-aa1e-c536e1a1b9b1 Make the sauce Scoop out all the spices that you had thrown in earlier and discard.
23e94b4d-7aa8-41ae-aa1e-c536e1a1b9b1 Make the sauce Pour in the starch solution. Cook, stirring, until thickened. Stir in the hoisin sauce, oyster sauce and sesame seed oil. Taste. Add salt, if needed (not more soy sauce because you don’t want the sauce to turn super dark). Set aside.
23e94b4d-7aa8-41ae-aa1e-c536e1a1b9b1 Stir fry the dish Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. Over extremely high heat, add the beef slices and cook until the beef starts to acquire some texture.
23e94b4d-7aa8-41ae-aa1e-c536e1a1b9b1 Stir fry the dish Add the drained noodles to the beef. Pour in the sauce. Cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally, just until the noodles are cooked through.
52562add-47f3-4898-a51b-4b6cb732c1eb
Boil water in a pot. Add a teaspoon of salt. Throw in the pasta. Stir during the first minute or two.
52562add-47f3-4898-a51b-4b6cb732c1eb
While the pasta cooks, cut the bacon into thin strips.
52562add-47f3-4898-a51b-4b6cb732c1eb
Slice the mushrooms thinly, if using.
52562add-47f3-4898-a51b-4b6cb732c1eb
Heat an oil-free pan. Add the bacon and cook until fat is rendered. Add the sliced mushrooms and continue cooking until both bacon and mushrooms are browned.
52562add-47f3-4898-a51b-4b6cb732c1eb
Drain the pasta and add to the pan with the bacon and mushrooms. Add half a cup of the cooking liquid, if you wish, to make the dish a little less dry. Toss to coat the noodles with bacon fat.
52562add-47f3-4898-a51b-4b6cb732c1eb
Sprinkle in the salted egg powder and pepper. Toss to distribute evenly. Taste and add more salted egg powder or pepper, or both, if you want bolder flavors.
52562add-47f3-4898-a51b-4b6cb732c1eb
Plate up your salted egg pasta carbonara. Sprinkle with Parmesan (skip if your pasta is perfectly salted already) and parsley before serving.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
Boil water to cook the macaroni in. Add a tablespoon of salt. Cook the macaroni until al dente.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
While the pasta cooks, peel the carrot and cut lengthwise into four pieces. Add to the macaroni and cook for five minutes. Fish out the carrot pieces, drain and cool.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
While the carrot cools and the pasta continues to cook, toast the pecans in an oil-free pan. Cool.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
Thinly slice the celery.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
Chop the cooled carrot.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
Chop the cooled pecans.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
Drain the pasta and cool.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
Add two tablespoons mayonnaise to the turkey. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix to moisten the meat.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
In a mixing bowl, toss the carrot, celery, pecans and crushed pineapple with 1/4 cup mayonnaise and a sprinkle of salt and pepper, all the sugar and grated Parmesan.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
Add the drained and cooled pasta to the mixing bowl. Add the turkey and the rest of the mayonnaise, and toss. Taste and adjust the seasonings, as needed. If the pasta appears too dry, add more mayo, toss then adjust the seasonings again.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
Chill the turkey macaroni and pecan salad for a few hours before serving.
fc0ff273-476d-43c5-bc1d-0a429997bc55
To serve, top with chopped parsley and more grated Parmesan.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Keep the beef stew simmering on the stove while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Blanch the noodles in boiling water for a minute. Drain. Plunge in iced water and allow to cool. Drain. Divide among six bowls.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Blanch the spinach in boiling water just long enough to wilt. Scoop out and divide into six portions.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Place one portion of spinach in every bowl on one side of the noodles.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Rinse the mung bean sprouts well and drain. Divide into six portions.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Ladle simmering broth directly into the bowls.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Arrange a few pieces of beef on one side of the noodles in the bowl.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Place a portion of mung bean sprouts in every bowl alongside.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Sprinkle in toasted sesame seeds and sliced scallions.
5519e202-b3b1-432e-ad1b-0c88635d594d
Serve the spicy beef noodle soup at once.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Cut the beef into strips about half an inch wide.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Place the beef strips in a bowl. Pour in the lemongrass chili sauce. Mix well. Set aside.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Boil a pot of water.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Dump the spinach into the boiling water and push down to submerge. Leave for a minute. Scoop out and drain. Rinse under the tap to cool, or dump in a bowl of icy water, drain once more then squeeze to remove excess water (see instructions). Roughly chop.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Allow the water to boil once more. Dump in the noodles. Allow to sit for a minute. Drain well and transfer to a bowl. While hot, pour in the soy sauce and toss.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Heat the sesame seed oil in a wok or frying pan. Saute the shallots and garlic for about half a minute.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Throw in the bell pepper. Sprinkle in a little salt and pepper. Stir fry for another half a minute.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Add the marinated beef to the wok, stir fry for about two minutes.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Stir in the chopped spinach.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Taste. Add more salt and pepper, if needed.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Add the marinated noodles to the beef and vegetables. Stir fry just until heated through, about a minute.
979a94ef-1b01-4f8b-b3e5-bd55d72ff3ad
Serve the lemongrass chili beef and noodles at once.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Prepare the noodles by blanching in boiling water for a few minutes, rinsing and draining.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
In a sauce pan, heat three cups of chicken broth with the rice wine. Add the garlic, ginger, soy sauce, black vinegar and pepper. Boil for two minutes.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Drop the chicken thigh fillets into the boiling broth. Lower the heat and poach the chicken for ten to 12 minutes or until just done. Scoop out and move to a chopping board.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Turn up the heat to bring the broth to boiling point once more.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Add the sliced shiitake mushrooms to the broth. Cook for one minute. Scoop out and transfer to a plate.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Next, add the julienned carrot to the broth. Cook for one minute. Scoop out and move to the plate next to the mushrooms.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Lastly, cook the cabbage for one minute in the broth. Scoop out and move to the plate with the mushrooms and carrot.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Disperse the starch in the remaining three tablespoons of broth. Pour into the boiling broth. Cook, stirring, until thick and clear. For best results, allow to simmer, stirring often, for a few minutes. Taste and adjust the seasonings, as needed.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Add the noodles to the thickened broth and stir. Pour in the beaten eggs and stir. Turn off the heat and let the eggs cook in the residual heat.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Thinly slice the chicken thigh fillets.
f8cf047b-2161-451d-88e0-d3a6b33922dd
Divide the noodles with thick broth and eggs among three bowls. Top with chicken, mushrooms, carrot and cabbage. Garnish with sliced scallions.
8b4e79eb-f382-4065-a6ac-8c45b3cb3bb5
740843cf-9a05-4bd3-a5b9-069d8562e851
08c5800a-6edc-4a8a-95d5-83251e73216f
0b67c1ad-0777-4bc2-bfa2-e8639214770f
75b9bbd7-bb94-4037-b69e-d9e1fb79f594
14fb1576-2966-454d-a170-81aa8e992438
16e64d0e-d7da-45f5-b4ae-9508de9c5ea6
