da0327df-4425-4f3a-ab15-69b356d84939
99bfd578-377e-4776-ab92-b2af2c6f51dc
37dcc118-29f0-429f-bfca-143f2270c511
3468998e-70bb-400e-a79c-84cf08348c09
6a58706e-12ff-4cfd-b656-2c68abe32686
498caee1-4e9e-4f5b-9cc5-771c9506b7d0
3b0cd9d2-0527-423c-8d5c-ff4f3c64239a
8275da21-c89e-4b43-a6b6-881560098949
98e78540-2048-4ac5-a155-8f27461aa012
7384c4ea-1d08-4bdf-8c00-0624cc21c16b
a30b7576-1a75-4421-8dc2-b0fc5d4910da
4a0436a2-7143-4b8d-951d-45b9763a3b38
2c927cf7-7550-427b-9c9a-9978cf6c516c
1ca3f421-3cb7-413f-908e-2c457d9d5c27
23f1b6b6-e860-4355-874b-b9b699490dc6
af1d05dd-153a-4a02-a217-b9a090ddfe54
2456a13a-7c65-40ad-864e-83e5f7716a86
cb3a83cb-cf41-4842-8c77-ea566a884ebd
03938c5f-374b-48cd-9cb8-97b515177803
16f7bd41-1a28-4b18-927e-019d80e3bbed
12ff402d-61d0-42b5-bcb9-a2408a76fdc6
8c17105c-681d-4e78-96d2-563b42794c6b
aa3af285-7f84-48e9-8227-23ae49b2896e
0edf4367-4ab7-40c2-afac-c01f7db728bc
1290e976-7bd6-4df4-a536-b2527048aeae
2e39dc87-d73f-42b7-9696-597447d65427
7007090a-f771-4a24-8fd7-55559ffd2aa3
70298cf7-76dc-4c3e-9d1d-187d0747c45a
1fe302f3-7b80-40bc-a571-ac89228b7ba7
Heat the cooking oil in a pot.
1fe302f3-7b80-40bc-a571-ac89228b7ba7
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until fragrant, about two minutes.
1fe302f3-7b80-40bc-a571-ac89228b7ba7
Pour in the broth. Bring to the boil.
1fe302f3-7b80-40bc-a571-ac89228b7ba7
Add the carrot slices, kikiam, pork and liver. Bring to the boil.
1fe302f3-7b80-40bc-a571-ac89228b7ba7
Add the cabbage and noodles. Bring to the boil, cover and simmer for five to 10 minutes. Simmering will soften the cabbage and allow the noodles to release some of the starch into the broth and thicken it slightly.
1fe302f3-7b80-40bc-a571-ac89228b7ba7
Season with patis and pepper. With the heat off, slowly pour in the beaten eggs in a thin stream. Allow to set slightly then stir through the pot.
1fe302f3-7b80-40bc-a571-ac89228b7ba7
If you like your liver just done, add the slices during the last few minutes of cooking.
1fe302f3-7b80-40bc-a571-ac89228b7ba7
Serve the pancit lomi piping hot.
67edb917-3aef-4963-ba94-41388e437925
bb51aa06-003e-4a60-8b10-fdb649a430ed
dba0684f-7efc-4660-b82b-cc16a96db0d2
2d837780-0bc3-46d4-a5ad-a64d2603ec3d
508a69c3-2758-476a-a439-57bb40eebca5
1c9d1449-3e79-4e2b-81fc-6addfb5e9546
Place the bones in a pot. Boil for 10 minutes until the scum rises.
1c9d1449-3e79-4e2b-81fc-6addfb5e9546
Throw out the water, rinse the bones and the pot.
1c9d1449-3e79-4e2b-81fc-6addfb5e9546
Return the bones to the pot, refill with water, add the onion, garlic and peppercorns, season with fish sauce and simmer for at least two hours.
1c9d1449-3e79-4e2b-81fc-6addfb5e9546
To serve, place the bones at the center of a large bowl, surround with the noodles, top with the trimmed herbs and pour in the simmering broth.
1c9d1449-3e79-4e2b-81fc-6addfb5e9546
Garnish with slices of lime, squeeze half a lime over everything and serve at once.
90f11d54-1d89-49f1-8ed3-64c7451bb104
Cook the pasta (see how to cook al dente pasta like a pro). Drain and reserve a cup of the pasta water.
90f11d54-1d89-49f1-8ed3-64c7451bb104
In the still hot pan but with the heat off, melt the butter.
90f11d54-1d89-49f1-8ed3-64c7451bb104
Add the hot pasta and toss a few times.
90f11d54-1d89-49f1-8ed3-64c7451bb104
Add all the cheese, toss and keep tossing until the cheese melts and turns into a creamy mixture.
90f11d54-1d89-49f1-8ed3-64c7451bb104
If the sauce is too thick, add the reserved pasta water, a tablespoon at a time, until the sauce has the consistency of thick cream.
90f11d54-1d89-49f1-8ed3-64c7451bb104
Taste the pasta. Add salt and pepper, as needed.
90f11d54-1d89-49f1-8ed3-64c7451bb104
Sprinkle with chopped parsley for a little color.
90f11d54-1d89-49f1-8ed3-64c7451bb104
Serve the pasta Alfredo at once.
a76f20be-0ad9-4730-a3a6-b226e861ee21
c5591e14-6fa4-44a4-9db5-bde5a0fd24ec
Heat a large saucepan or casserole. Transfer 1 tbsp. of cooking oil from the skillet or wok.
c5591e14-6fa4-44a4-9db5-bde5a0fd24ec
Saute the garlic and onion until the onion is soft.
c5591e14-6fa4-44a4-9db5-bde5a0fd24ec
Pour in the broth. Bring to a boil.
c5591e14-6fa4-44a4-9db5-bde5a0fd24ec
Add the meat balls. Lower the heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
c5591e14-6fa4-44a4-9db5-bde5a0fd24ec
Adjust seasonings, as needed. Turn off the heat.
c5591e14-6fa4-44a4-9db5-bde5a0fd24ec
Add the misua and cover for another 5 minutes.
c5591e14-6fa4-44a4-9db5-bde5a0fd24ec
Transfer to a soup tureen and top with sliced scallions. Serve hot.
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
Wipe the chicken bones dry with paper towels.
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
Heat the cooking oil in a sauce pan.
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
Spread the chicken bones in the hot oil and brown all sides over medium-high heat (see notes after the recipe).
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
Add the rice, lemongrass, pandan leaves and ginger slices.
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
Pour in four cups of water.
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
Simmer the rice and chicken bones, stirring occasionally.
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
When the rice is cooked through, taste and add patis.
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
If the mixture appears too thick (see notes after the recipe), add more water and continue simmering, stirring more often, until the rice grains burst and turn mushy.
90bff04f-9856-48ea-99a9-2e91043b7431
Fish out the chicken bones, lemongrass, pandan leaves and ginger before serving the lugaw.
45dd08c5-3c0d-422e-b0af-a05bcab83991
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
Cut the SPAM into small cubes.
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
Heat the cooking oil in a non-stick frying pan (make sure the entire bottom is coated with oil).
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
Spread the SPAM cubes in the hot oil and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and crisp on all sides.
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
In the mixture of oil and rendered fat from the SPAM, saute the garlic.
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
Turn up the heat, add the rice and stir fry until heated through and aromatic.
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
Add the chopped laing to the rice. Stir and continue cooking until the laing is evenly distributed.
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
Taste. Add salt and pepper, if needed, and toss to blend.
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
Scatter the fried SPAM cubes over the laing fried rice and toss to distribute.
615ee770-2a53-4660-8559-1cb5c4996911
Ladle the laing and SPAM fried rice into bowls, sprinkle with grated Parmesan and serve immediately.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Heat a frying pan and pour in a tablespoon of oil.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Saute the mushrooms and green beans with a bit of salt and pepper until the beans are cooked through and the mixture is almost dry.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Scoop out the mushrooms and green beans, transfer to a plate and set aside.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Pour the remaining cooking oil into the pan.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Saute the shallot until softened, about a minute.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Add the shrimp paste, garlic and chili flakes. Cook, stirring often, until the solids separate from the oil.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Turn up the heat and dump in the rice. Cook, tossing and stirring, until the rice is heated through.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Add the green beans and mushrooms to the rice. Cook, tossing, for another minute.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Taste the rice and adjust the seasonings, if needed.
cc288b9c-a902-48c8-8cbd-c4292679127a
Serve the chili bagoong fried rice immediately.
96959be6-3993-412b-91cf-86aa0c1bf584
Rinse the rice several times, drain, place in a bowl and cover with water. Cover the bowl and keep in the fridge for at least six hours.
96959be6-3993-412b-91cf-86aa0c1bf584
Drain the rice. Cook in coconut milk with the salt (I used a rice cooker and it did the job wonderfully).
96959be6-3993-412b-91cf-86aa0c1bf584
Prepare the banana leaves by trimming and wilting (see illustration).
96959be6-3993-412b-91cf-86aa0c1bf584
Cut the banana leaves so that you have 8 to 10 pieces that are about 8"x8" square and another set of 8 to 10 pieces that are about 12"x12" square.
96959be6-3993-412b-91cf-86aa0c1bf584
Place an 8"x8" piece of banana leaf on top of a 12"x12" piece. Place two to three tablespoonfuls of cooked rice at the center.
96959be6-3993-412b-91cf-86aa0c1bf584
Wrap the rice with the smaller piece of banana leaf, as tightly as you can, and folding the sides neatly. Use the larger piece of banana leaf to wrap the parcel. The double wrapping seals the rice well and serves as an insurance that in case the first wrapping tears, there is another layer to protect the precious rice inside. Repeat until all the rice has been wrapped.
96959be6-3993-412b-91cf-86aa0c1bf584
Stack the parcels, seam side down, in a steamer basket. Steam over boiling water for about 45 minutes.
96959be6-3993-412b-91cf-86aa0c1bf584
Cool the suman for about 15 minutes before unwrapping to give it a chance to firm up. Top with grated fresh coconut and sugar, and enjoy!
fdfdc379-4a78-4116-9caa-9e9135e8f179
4c4384af-429b-40fe-8596-227df8b7dea5
d2a989ce-7335-47c1-8022-5df66eee30db
99b5fca6-11ca-4711-8420-a88ab1ea926a
99b5fca6-11ca-4711-8420-a88ab1ea926a
a9e2009c-c53f-40ef-a600-3aa5ae38d70c
a9e2009c-c53f-40ef-a600-3aa5ae38d70c
cb9a9d15-21e4-4d01-9b74-dcd38337ac7e
Spread the walnuts in an oil-free pan and sprinkle with salt. Toast, shaking the pan occasionally, until aromatic. Set aside.
cb9a9d15-21e4-4d01-9b74-dcd38337ac7e
Pour the milk into a sauce pan and crumble the cold rice directly into the milk. Add a generous pinch of salt.
cb9a9d15-21e4-4d01-9b74-dcd38337ac7e
Heat the milk and rice slowly, keeping the stove on the lowest setting.
cb9a9d15-21e4-4d01-9b74-dcd38337ac7e
When the milk and rice are simmering, add the dark chocolate and stir. Cook, still over low heat with occasional stirring, until the chocolate is completely melted.
cb9a9d15-21e4-4d01-9b74-dcd38337ac7e
Ladle the cooked champorado into four bowls. Sprinkle with milk chocolate morsels and salted toasted walnuts. Serve at once.
c56038cb-ae88-436e-b51c-66564a4c6ffd
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan.
c56038cb-ae88-436e-b51c-66564a4c6ffd
Over medium-low heat, cook the onion, carrot, bell peppers and garlic with a few pinches of salt and pepper until softened and aromatic, about five minutes.
c56038cb-ae88-436e-b51c-66564a4c6ffd
Dump the meat, sausages and eggplants into the pan; cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through and the eggplants are done but still firm.
c56038cb-ae88-436e-b51c-66564a4c6ffd
Meanwhile, crumble the rice to separate the grains; toss with the Italian seasoning and paprika.
c56038cb-ae88-436e-b51c-66564a4c6ffd
Add the rice to the meat and vegetables. Cook, tossing gently, until heated through.
c56038cb-ae88-436e-b51c-66564a4c6ffd
Toss in the olives and cook for another half a minute.
c56038cb-ae88-436e-b51c-66564a4c6ffd
Taste the rice. Add more salt and pepper, if needed, and toss to blend.
c56038cb-ae88-436e-b51c-66564a4c6ffd
Serve the paprika rice with grilled pork and Italian sausages immediately.
ac935dc3-4868-4bad-a3ef-8187f8b2a51a
Rinse the Japanese rice until the water runs clear. Cook in the rice cooker.
ac935dc3-4868-4bad-a3ef-8187f8b2a51a
While the rice cooks, soak the black fungus in hot water until softened and doubled in volume. Drain and chop.
ac935dc3-4868-4bad-a3ef-8187f8b2a51a
Take the cooked rice and spread on a tray. Use a fork to fluff it up. Cool completely.
ac935dc3-4868-4bad-a3ef-8187f8b2a51a
Mix all the ingredients together except for the lettuce.
ac935dc3-4868-4bad-a3ef-8187f8b2a51a
With wet hands (to prevent the rice from sticking on your skin), shape the rice mixture into balls or flattened triangles (or whatever shape you prefer, really).
ac935dc3-4868-4bad-a3ef-8187f8b2a51a
Spread the lettuce on a platter.
ac935dc3-4868-4bad-a3ef-8187f8b2a51a
Arrange the smoked salmon and furikake onigiri on top.
9f976d30-4506-432f-a336-14ef53e40a43
Rinse the rice several times until the water runs clear. Drain well.
9f976d30-4506-432f-a336-14ef53e40a43
Dump the rice into the rice cooker.
9f976d30-4506-432f-a336-14ef53e40a43
Add the tomato sauce (and water or broth if it needs to be diluted).
9f976d30-4506-432f-a336-14ef53e40a43
Turn the rice cooker on and let it do its work.
9f976d30-4506-432f-a336-14ef53e40a43
Tip: Because the tomato sauce is liquid plus mushy solids, one cup of tomato sauce is not equal to one cup water in the context of water to rice ratio. You may need to add more water or broth toward the end of cooking time to make sure that the rice gets cooked through.
9f976d30-4506-432f-a336-14ef53e40a43
Fluff up the rice when done.
9f976d30-4506-432f-a336-14ef53e40a43
Serve the rice cooked in tomato sauce topped with chopped parsley.
b8b531e0-bbca-4190-b37d-11a343584725
Soak the rice in cold water for 30 minutes. Drain well and dump into the rice cooker.
b8b531e0-bbca-4190-b37d-11a343584725
Pour in the broth.
b8b531e0-bbca-4190-b37d-11a343584725
Lightly crush the tomatoes with your hand and add to the rice.
b8b531e0-bbca-4190-b37d-11a343584725
Throw in the corn and green beans.
b8b531e0-bbca-4190-b37d-11a343584725
Sprinkle in salt and pepper, if needed.
b8b531e0-bbca-4190-b37d-11a343584725
Turn on the rice cooker and let it do its work.
b8b531e0-bbca-4190-b37d-11a343584725
When the corn and bean rice is done, fluff up with a fork to separate the grains before serving.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Rinse the mussels several times. Place in a bowl. Cover with water. Soak in the fridge for several hours.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Clean the squids (see how) and cut into chunks.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Cut off the antennae of the shrimps. I do not recommend peeling the shrimps.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Take a shrimp and pierce with a toothpick between the first and second segments of the shell counting from the head. Twist the toothpick then pull out to remove the black thread that runs through the length of the shrimp (see the technique). Alternatively, cut the shell along its back to expose the black thread to make it easier to remove (see how). Repeat with the rest of the shrimps.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Take the mussels out of the fridge and rinse again. Pull off the beards.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Boil six cups of water in a pot with two tablespoons of salt. When the water is boiling, dump in the mussels. Once the mussels open, scoop them out and set aside. Optionally, when cool enough to handle, you may break off and discard the empty half shells.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Scoop a cup of the hot mussel broth into a bowl. Drop in the saffron threads. Leave to soak for five minutes.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Pour the rice in the rice cooker. Add the mussel broth and saffron with the soaking liquid. Cook the rice as you ordinarily would in the rice cooker.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Meanwhile, heat half of the olive oil in the paella pan.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Over medium-high heat, cook the shrimps hot olive oil with a teaspoon of salt and a quarter teaspoon of pepper. DO NOT OVERCOOK. Two minutes on each side should do it. Scoop out and set aside.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
In the remaining oil, still over medium-high heat, cook the squids with a teaspoon of salt and a quarter teaspoon of pepper. Again, DO NOT OVERCOOK. Two to three minutes with occasional stirring should be sufficient. Scoop out and set aside.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Turn down the heat to medium. Pour the remaining olive oil in the paella pan. Saute the garlic, onion and bell peppers with the paprika and bay leaves.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Turn up the heat to high. Scoop out the cooked rice directly into the paella pan. Add the peas. Stir. Taste and add more salt and pepper, if needed.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Spread the rice evenly on the paella pan. Arrange the shrimps, squids and mussels on top. Continue cooking over high heat (a little scorching at the bottom gives the paella a more authentic touch) for three to five minutes or just until the shrimps, squids and mussels are heated through.
d98267d4-0d2b-4c89-8536-70000a1022fa
Sprinkle the seafood paella with thinly sliced basil leaves and serve immediately.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Cut the chorizos into rings about half an inch thick.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Cut the bacon into thin strips.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Peel and roughly chop the onion.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Peel (or not) the carrot and cut into half-inch cubes.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Thinly slice the cabbage.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Heat the olive oil in a wide pan.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Spread the chorizo and bacon on the pan. Cook over medium-high heat without disturbing for about two minutes. Stir and continue cooking until lightly browned and fat has been rendered.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Add the chopped onion to the meat in the pan. Saute until softened and translucent.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Add the carrot cubes and cabbage strips. Stir until the vegetables are coated with oil. Note that I do not advise adding salt and pepper at this point because the sausages and bacon contain a lot of salt and spices already. If those aren't enough, you may adjust the seasonings later.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Pour in the rice followed by the broth (or water). Note that the capacity of rice to absorb water differs from one variety to the next. To be on the safe side, use only a cup and a half of liquid. You can add more later if needed. Stir to distribute everything evenly. Bring to a simmer.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Scatter the peas over the contents of the pan.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Cover the pan, set the heat to low and let everything cook together for 10 minutes. Check the rice. If still underdone, drizzle in another quarter cup of broth or water and continue cooking for a couple of minutes.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
When all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice is fully cooked, taste and add salt and pepper, if needed.
764173fe-342b-4bd0-ac5f-20bd109746ed
Ladle the rice into plates or bowls. Top each bowl of rice with a fried egg. Sprinkle in some sliced scallions. Serve the arroz con chorizo while hot.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Debone the chicken breast. Reserve the bone.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Cut the chicken meat into half-inch wide strips about a quarter of an inch thick.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Cut the pork into strips the same size as the chicken.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Peel and thinly slice the shallots.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Crush, peel and mince the garlic.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Peel and grate the ginger and turmeric.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Deseed and dice the bell peppers.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Rinse the sweet peas. Drain well.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Heat the cooking oil in a wide thick-bottomed frying pan.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Saute the shallots and garlic until fragrant.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Add the grated ginger and turmeric with their juices.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Spread the chicken strips on the bottom of the pan. Cook over medium-high heat without disturbing for about a minute. Flip them over and cook for a minute.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Drizzle in a about one tablespoon of fish sauce and sprinkle in some pepper.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Stir the chicken. Cook for another minute (the chicken strips are a quarter of an inch thick and that means a short cooking time!).
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Move the chicken strips to a plate and set aside.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Spread the pork strips on the bottom of the pan. Brown for a minute, flip over and brown the opposite side.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Pour in one cup coconut milk. Throw in the reserved chicken breast bone. Season with a tablespoon of fish sauce and sprinkle in more pepper. Stir.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Bring the mixture to a simmer. Cover the pan and set the heat to low. Cook the pork until done and the mixture is almost dry, about 30 minutes.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Pour in two cups of coconut milk. Stir. Taste. Add more fish sauce and pepper, if needed.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Stir in the glutinous (sticky) rice, regular rice and Japanese rice.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Add the bell peppers and peas. Stir.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Cover the pan and let the rice cook in the coconut milk until done. Check after 25 minutes. If the coconut milk has been completely absorbed but rice is still undercooked, pour in more coconut milk.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Spread the cooked chicken strips over the rice.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
Cook the brighe until the rice is done, all the coconut milk has been absorbed and the chicken has been heated through.
3ef13787-1a3f-45a7-b36b-0aef1410cbb4
To serve, garnish the bringhe with wedges of hard-boiled eggs and, optionally, scallions and more bell peppers.
7d4321b0-3fce-4bf2-a0da-43ecaccc2f2f
In a mixing bowl, mix the rice, chopped chorizo, Parmesan, eggs and, optionally, salt and pepper.
7d4321b0-3fce-4bf2-a0da-43ecaccc2f2f
Scoop some of the rice mixture using a measuring spoon or small ice cream scoop. Place a cheese cube at the center. Gather to form a ball making sure that no part of the cheese is exposed. Repeat until all the rice mixture has been used.
7d4321b0-3fce-4bf2-a0da-43ecaccc2f2f
Place the rice balls in container in a single layer. Cover the container and chill the rice balls for at least 30 minutes.
7d4321b0-3fce-4bf2-a0da-43ecaccc2f2f
Start heating the oil in a wok or frying pan.
7d4321b0-3fce-4bf2-a0da-43ecaccc2f2f
Take the rice balls out of the fridge and roll each one in panko.
7d4321b0-3fce-4bf2-a0da-43ecaccc2f2f
When the oil has reached a temperature of 350F, fry the rice balls in batches. Turn then around occasionally for even frying. When the crust is a golden brown, scoop out and move to a plate lined with paper towels.
7d4321b0-3fce-4bf2-a0da-43ecaccc2f2f
Serve the arancini-style cheese-stuffed rice balls with tomato sauce on the side for dipping.
295713fc-35e2-4044-9bb2-71413df01d93
Rinse the rice several times until the water runs clear. Drain. Place in the rice cooker and pour in three cups of water. Cook.
295713fc-35e2-4044-9bb2-71413df01d93
While the rice cooks, place the dried wakame in a bowl and pour in enough hot water to cover.
295713fc-35e2-4044-9bb2-71413df01d93
Chop the bacon and cook in an oil-free frying pan until browned and lightly crisp. Drain (save the bacon fat for future use).
295713fc-35e2-4044-9bb2-71413df01d93
When the rice is done, transfer to a shallow bowl and mix lightly to separate the grains. Pour in the rice vinegar and sesame seed oil. Stir to blend.
295713fc-35e2-4044-9bb2-71413df01d93
Drain the wakame and squeeze out excess water. Finely chop.
295713fc-35e2-4044-9bb2-71413df01d93
Add the bacon, chopped wakame and sesame seeds to the rice. Mix to combine. Taste. Add salt, if needed, and mix again.
295713fc-35e2-4044-9bb2-71413df01d93
Form into balls or triangles to make onigiri.
295713fc-35e2-4044-9bb2-71413df01d93
Serve your crispy bacon, wakame and sesame onigiri as a side dish to meat, seafood or vegetable main dish.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Spread the hot adlai on a tray or baking sheet to cool.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Meanwhile, prepare the rest of the ingredients. Peel and chop the carrot.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Remove the seeds and white pith of the bell pepper, then chop.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Peel and chop the shallot or onion.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Cut the pork belly slices into strips about half an inch wide.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Thinly slice the Chinese sausages.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Throw the pork belly strips into the hot oil. Season with salt and pepper. Stir fry for about five minutes or until cooked through and lightly browned.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Add the chopped carrot, bell pepper and shallot (or onion) to the pork. Season with more salt and pepper. Stir fry for a minute or two.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Add the sliced Chinese sausages to the pork and vegetables in the wok. Stir fry for half a minute.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Take the cooled adlai and dump into the wok. Pour in the soy sauce, oyster sauce and hoisin sauce. Stir fry until the adlai is heated through. Taste and add more salt and pepper, as needed.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Make a well in the center of the wok and pour in the beaten eggs. When the eggs start to set along the edges, stir them into the adlai using a slow circular motion so that you gather more adlai with every circle you make.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Off the heat, drizzle in the sesame seed oil and stir to blend.
2dfd2d7c-c5cb-4a11-9fb7-d837d12b414b
Serve the fried adlai a la yang chow immediately.
2be48163-5d52-4639-be8b-04d546b9ac8c
121232cd-0275-424e-924f-bd2e1be9e257
7f59c0a9-b5b5-4d75-bf33-ef61b0c8f041
3e773944-fe80-4bf2-aa09-dd317ac5959d
4888544c-42af-4ff8-8541-5b4b8f47bd64
59ef3979-0605-45b7-bcc1-03069d90ff78
802c838a-23f6-42d5-8390-f1fdd3a50d6e
5401b467-be4b-4f8e-b242-f9ec07349224
010c41ef-4252-4b12-9c6e-02551945e4aa
dd2eac41-9150-4add-8bc7-44b48bd75f51
1f9e8fa0-9d30-4511-90b5-d71d72783df0
9a847a0e-4fe5-491e-9df0-7d7bac1b612c
659cbd5e-3f26-4eda-899f-b73c1ef49093
6206aa4b-797f-4836-b40c-d02e38b7d340
6206aa4b-797f-4836-b40c-d02e38b7d340
221247a6-567d-4a87-8bbc-aff57c2e7d3f
db7e27d7-4b0f-40e2-ae15-05eeddce5cb7
960666b2-a458-4023-bfe2-81af6d46dd4b
a32822c6-741a-4805-92f7-cc4a6f36b6ea
Place the meat in a bowl. Season with all the marinating ingredients. Leave to marinate for at least an hour.
ea9256de-fcf9-453c-a709-590d19692682
7d14562a-1123-4fe7-bbf3-9af441cbd248
9c68fcc4-7607-4e83-a9b4-62220b4dc8ee
cbed78a1-4c73-47c8-8556-fbc735645d23
cbed78a1-4c73-47c8-8556-fbc735645d23
cbed78a1-4c73-47c8-8556-fbc735645d23
331a0628-bc53-444b-8e01-7d0f67ae77a7
5bc870de-96a4-4354-81ea-6b6f42334def
45b74506-ff19-4943-ad69-2409de33ab84
f6cc3575-93b3-41f4-bd34-2390623620f8
7b1a34a3-b849-4fd3-9d80-948c95fcbcbe
f75e1319-9c5f-4f3c-9802-b2e4351fa9ee
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan. Add the meat, season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with paprika. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the meat pieces are lightly browned.
f75e1319-9c5f-4f3c-9802-b2e4351fa9ee
To serve, place some of the rice on a plate, top with egg and, optionally, sprinkle with the more basil (see how to make basil chiffonade).
c82fb209-ee51-4141-9ca2-956b81b45ff9
f7b2539c-09a0-4403-821d-a3efa0159554
49083c1f-9c14-44d0-8e48-44f94ee589ac
2e784ddd-3578-41a7-877a-2cddf5a84321
865600da-e05f-4517-83d7-d786aa0d2596
1cecea8c-35eb-4155-bd6e-0c70828036cd
2262d4d6-0a47-45db-ae32-71e801ca2096
d8016d51-8c18-46de-b95b-f767ee468247
26bbd086-2d11-4592-8f70-4acfd6dbb8b7
09235663-489a-4254-9425-a4280df64990
e3b34e20-3726-4618-9bd7-7fbd9f5f01c6
Garnish with sliced scallions and cilantro.
7ea17342-473b-4914-a31c-a9d974340b03
fbcf1c69-0225-47d2-a7c4-aa249a133b25
b22a765b-0de0-4eed-9544-10ce92e71a4c
1b85484c-f015-4b61-a820-24a734e0dd68
2950e88f-fd20-4fb5-af3b-bdabc922f352
6d531b14-2246-4cd6-af71-08034bee2cf6
0ca900ac-c837-4968-b11b-1f642c1e3cc1
ae2e8109-9766-46bd-9e99-fe5e443e5061
fae5f0cd-e58a-4c57-84a2-aa5c0f7dc5e2
cddb4ee7-ca2b-4558-8f2e-2324b8f822e7
b336ed40-88ee-4c61-8e6c-caa9f42c525f
Prepare the custard. Mix together the milk, honey and pancake syrup mixture, flour and coconut milk.
b336ed40-88ee-4c61-8e6c-caa9f42c525f
Cook over low heat, stirring, until thick.
b336ed40-88ee-4c61-8e6c-caa9f42c525f
Beat the egg yolk in a bowl, pour half of the milk-flour mixture, beat until smooth, then pour the egg mixture back into the pan. Cook over low heat for another minute or so.
b336ed40-88ee-4c61-8e6c-caa9f42c525f
Cool completely before cutting to make sure that both the pudding and the custard are firm enough.
a92bd9f5-710c-4190-90b4-6a49d56c71fd
Form the cooked milk mixture into small logs.
a92bd9f5-710c-4190-90b4-6a49d56c71fd
Drop the shaped pastillas directly into the sugar and roll to coat every inch of the surface.
ae5d1bff-64f8-4556-bfb6-1ecd75fc8256
Coat the bottom of an 8" x 8' baking pan with caramelized sugar (click the link for instructions).
ae5d1bff-64f8-4556-bfb6-1ecd75fc8256 Make custard
ae5d1bff-64f8-4556-bfb6-1ecd75fc8256 Make the sponge cake So, there you have your custard cake. All you have to do is to slice it and serve.
6399a393-747a-47c3-bf4b-61f53efa10ec
Using two teaspoons, form the ube jam into one-inch balls. Arrange on a tray and stick in the freezer for about 10 minutes. Semi freezing the filling will make it easier to stuff the jam into the rice balls.
6399a393-747a-47c3-bf4b-61f53efa10ec
Drop a semi-frozen ube jam at the center of each rice ball.
6399a393-747a-47c3-bf4b-61f53efa10ec
Fry the ube buchi over high heat until the crust is crisp and golden brown.
6399a393-747a-47c3-bf4b-61f53efa10ec
Serve the ube buchi while hot.
51e8c7cb-231c-4a5c-805e-b934b0402bad
9cc66aa7-6fb7-4ae1-a8d6-86db1cfbaf35
Add the egg and egg white to the butter-sugar mixture and mix until well incorporated.
9cc66aa7-6fb7-4ae1-a8d6-86db1cfbaf35
Add the flour mixture and mix well.
9cc66aa7-6fb7-4ae1-a8d6-86db1cfbaf35
Add the sliced almonds and mix until well blended. The batter will be heavy.
9cc66aa7-6fb7-4ae1-a8d6-86db1cfbaf35
Transfer to a greased 8" x 8" baking pan. Spread evenly, using a spatula.
9cc66aa7-6fb7-4ae1-a8d6-86db1cfbaf35
Bake in a 180C oven for 25 minutes.
9cc66aa7-6fb7-4ae1-a8d6-86db1cfbaf35
As soon as the baking pan comes out of the oven, sprinkle the chocolate morsels over the cooked cookie. Wait a minute or two until the chocolate morsels soften from the heat of the cookie. With a spatula, spread the chocolate evenly over the entire surface.
9cc66aa7-6fb7-4ae1-a8d6-86db1cfbaf35
Sprinkle with desired garnish.
9cc66aa7-6fb7-4ae1-a8d6-86db1cfbaf35
Cool completely before cutting into 3" x 3" squares.
13834ac6-178b-4e31-a43a-a9d8ddc61509
In an oil-free pan, toast the almond flour and ground pecans over medium heat. About five minutes, tossing often, should be just enough time. Cool completely.
13834ac6-178b-4e31-a43a-a9d8ddc61509
Stir together the cooled almond flour-nuts mixture, powdered milk, sugar and salt.
13834ac6-178b-4e31-a43a-a9d8ddc61509
Pour in the melted butter and mix until well blended.
13834ac6-178b-4e31-a43a-a9d8ddc61509
Press into a polvoron mold to shape (see notes below).
13834ac6-178b-4e31-a43a-a9d8ddc61509
For best results, chill before serving.
c393e2ee-859f-4e87-80e7-c00d3de22fc2
525bfd13-8b7f-4722-a380-d2b4e21bf0e6
Toast the flour in an oil-free pan until lightly browned and nutty in aroma. Cool completely.
525bfd13-8b7f-4722-a380-d2b4e21bf0e6
When cool, stir together the flour, milk, sugar, crushed Oreo cookies, cocoa powder and salt in a bowl.
525bfd13-8b7f-4722-a380-d2b4e21bf0e6
Pour in the melted butter and mix until well-blended.
525bfd13-8b7f-4722-a380-d2b4e21bf0e6
Fill the mold with the mixture. Use the back of a spoon to press the mixture into the mold to make sure it is firmly packed.
525bfd13-8b7f-4722-a380-d2b4e21bf0e6
Push the mold handle to release the polvoron.
525bfd13-8b7f-4722-a380-d2b4e21bf0e6
Repeat for the rest of the mixture.
525bfd13-8b7f-4722-a380-d2b4e21bf0e6
Arrange the cookies and cream polvoron in a single layer in a container. Cover and chill.
525bfd13-8b7f-4722-a380-d2b4e21bf0e6
Optionally, wrap individually when well chilled and firm enough to handle without crumbling.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Preheat the oven to 350F.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Brush the inside of two 9"x5" (or 8½"x4½") pans with butter. Optionally, line with baking paper (to make lifting the baked cake out of the pan easier).
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
In a large mixing bowl, mash the bananas until pasty.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Pour the melted butter over the mashed bananas and stir until incorporated.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Mix in the salt, baking soda, eggs, sugar and vanilla extract.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Mix in the flour.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Pour in the buttermilk and stir just until you get a uniform consistency
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Finally, stir in the nuts.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Pour the banana cake batter into the two prepared pans.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Bake the banana cake at 350F for 30 to 35 minutes.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Remove the cake pans from the oven, cool for five minutes and remove the cakes from the pans. Rest the banana cakes on a rack.
638cca72-8743-4ef3-98fa-b977dc1afa24
Cut the banana cakes into slices and serve. They're best while still warm.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Make the pie crust, form into a ball, wrap in cling film and chill for at least an hour.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Preheat the oven to 375F.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Take the pie crust dough out of the fridge, unwrap and lay on a lightly floured working surface.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Roll out the dough, working from the center going outward toward all directions, to a thickness of one-fourth inch.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Cut out four circles to fit into your ramekins (see notes after the recipe).
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Take one circle of dough, lower into a ramekin and gently push inside to snugly cover the bottom and sides. Repeat until you have four ramekins lined with pie crust dough.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Re-roll the remaining dough and cut into strips about half an inch wide (or narrower).
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
In a mixing bowl, toss together the mangoes, peaches, sugar, corn starch, salt, vanilla and cinnamon.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Divide the fruit filling into four portions and spoon into the dough-lined ramekins.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Take the strips of dough and arrange, lattice-style, on top of the filling.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Brush the dough strips and edges of the bottom crust with egg wash. Optionally, you may form a braid with dough strips and arrange the braid to cover where the top and bottom crusts meet. Brush any additional dough with egg wash.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Bake the pies at 375F for 20 minutes then lower the temperature to 350F and bake for 10 minutes more.
50a97f58-7196-4d59-8131-1dff333e15be
Serve the mango and peach pies hot, warm or chilled.
2a3f6ae0-5f12-490d-b692-f5d9ad107706
Lightly butter the bottom and sides of an 8" x 8" pan. Line with baking paper, leaving a two-inch overhang. Butter the baking paper.
2a3f6ae0-5f12-490d-b692-f5d9ad107706
Add the eggs and mix until smooth.
2a3f6ae0-5f12-490d-b692-f5d9ad107706
Sprinkle the chopped pistachio nuts on top of the brownie batter.
2a3f6ae0-5f12-490d-b692-f5d9ad107706
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes at 350F or until a toothpick inserted at the center comes out with very few crumbs.
2a3f6ae0-5f12-490d-b692-f5d9ad107706
Cut into two-inch squares.
1adb4fae-e142-4c1c-8d00-ea7786d5605a
Using an ice cream scoop (how large or small is up to you), form the ice cream into balls. Arrange the balls side by side on a tray and stick the tray in the freezer until the ice cream balls are really firm, about two hours.
1adb4fae-e142-4c1c-8d00-ea7786d5605a
Place the nuts, cookies, puffed rice, toasted coconut and sweetened coconut flakes in shallow bowls.
1adb4fae-e142-4c1c-8d00-ea7786d5605a
Roll each ice cream ball in any one of them.
1adb4fae-e142-4c1c-8d00-ea7786d5605a
Rearrange the crusted ice cream balls on the tray and put back in the freezer.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the cake Peel the cassava and finely grate. Any metal grater will do; a food processor cuts down the prep time tremendously.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the cake Preheat the oven to 350F.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the cake In a bowl, beat the eggs with the salt. Add the melted butter, sugar, evaporated milk, full-fat milk and coconut milk and stir until the sugar is dissolved.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the cake Add the grated cassava to the egg-milk mixture and stir thoroughly.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the cake Pour the cake batter into an oven-proof dish set on a baking tray. Stir to distribute the cassava evenly. (You may use any shape of dish but remember that you will be adding custard later, so, the cake batter should reach less than halfway up the baking dish.)
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the cake Bake the cassava cake for 25 to 30 minutes or until film and the top is lightly browned.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the custard In a thick-bottomed pan, mix together all the ingredients for the custard except the egg yolks. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the custard Take half a cup of the thickened mixture, pour over the egg yolks and stir to temper the yolks.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Make the custard Pour the egg yolk mixture into the pan and cook, stirring, for another minute.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Assemble the cake When the cassava cake is done, take it out of the oven and pour the custard on top.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Assemble the cake Switch the oven to broiler setting (top heat only) and bake the cake for another five minutes or so or until the surface of the custard is browned in spots. If your oven does not have a broiler setting, the usual setting will do but browning the top of the custard may take a little longer.
f198ed28-2b1e-4cc4-a19e-e5baa1589196 Assemble the cake Cool the cassava cake completely before cutting.
99dba4af-742e-4027-9600-d7dd0ef19755
c63072b2-16ca-45ed-a0b7-8411cd945011
Grease the bottom and sides of a 7″x11″ baking dish with coconut oil (substitute softened butter if you don’t have coconut oil).
2db5eba1-ee86-40a2-a1a8-89cd5517e42f
Whisk the oil and sugar until smooth (I used a wire whisk). Add the egg, whisk until incorporated. Add the a third of the flour and mix. Add half of the buttermilk and mix. Add another third of the flour, then the remaining half of the buttermilk and, finally, the last third of the flour, mixing after each addition. Stir in the red food color and vanilla extract.
2db5eba1-ee86-40a2-a1a8-89cd5517e42f
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted at the center of the cupcake comes out clean.
0143e2bb-30fa-4c46-93ab-d64377385784
Place two heaping tablespoonfuls of the cheese-cream mixture into wine glasses. Cover with the coffee-soaked lady fingers. Top with two more tablespoonfuls of the cheese-cream mixture then sprinkle with grated or shaved chocolate.
0143e2bb-30fa-4c46-93ab-d64377385784
Chill for an hour before serving.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the filling Place the chopped palm sugar in a thick-bottomed pan and add a tablespoon of water. Melt over medium-low heat until fully dissolved.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the filling Stir in the grated coconut and salt. Continue cooking, stirring often, for a minute or two or until quite dry.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the filling Cool the filling.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the crepes Cut the pandan leaves into small pieces. Place in the food processor or blender and add half a cup of hot water. Steep until cool. Process until finely chopped.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the crepes Stain the leaves to get the extract.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the crepes In a bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the crepes Pour in the pandan extract and coconut milk. Stir until smooth.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the crepes Heat a crepe pan (or an ordinary frying pan) and brush lightly with oil.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the crepes Pour about a quarter cup of the crepe batter and swirl the pan to make the batter spread thinly.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the crepes Cook the crepe just until set. Flip and cook for a few seconds longer.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Make the crepes Repeat until all the batter has been used.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Assemble the coconut pandan crepes Lay a crepe flat on a plate.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Assemble the coconut pandan crepes Place a heaping tablespoon of the filling across the center.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Assemble the coconut pandan crepes Fold in the two sides then fold in the side nearest you. Roll the crepe outward to completely seal the filling.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Assemble the coconut pandan crepes Repeat until all the crepes have been filled or until you run out of filling.
1c98fd4f-3f39-476a-841e-ba77d5ae4cd0 Assemble the coconut pandan crepes Sprinkle the coconut pandan crepes with toasted sesame seeds before serving.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Chop or grate the chocolate.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Cut the butter into small cubes.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Melt the butter and chocolate in a double boiler.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour baking powder and salt. Set aside.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
In another mixing bowl, beat the eggs and sugar until double and volume; the mixture should fall into slow ribbons when the beater is lifted. Stir in the almond extract.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Fold the flour mixture into the chocolate mixture.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Fold the flour-chocolate mixture into the egg-sugar mixture.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Cover the bowl with cling film. Chill for one to two hours or until firm enough to handle and form into balls.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Preheat the oven to 170C.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Sift the powdered sugar into a shallow bowl.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Take the cookie mixture out of the fridge.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Take a small ice cream scoop and use it to scoop the stiff dough into equal sizes.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Take each piece of dough, form into a ball using your hands then roll in powdered sugar. Tap off any excess.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Arrange the cookie balls on a lined baking tray about two inches apart.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Bake at 170C for 14 to 15 minutes or until firm around the edges but still chewy at the center. Note that if your oven is rather small, you may need to bake the cookies in batches or use more than one baking tray.
5bcb0d7c-cd35-4740-8b35-0078b75810a9
Cool the cookies on a rack. The chocolate crinkles can be stored in the freezer in a resealable bag or any container with a tight cover. Thaw to soften before serving.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Toast the chopped nuts in an oil-free pan. Set aside to cool.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Slice the dates then roughly chop. Set aside.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Place a silicone mat over a chopping board. Spread half of the dates and nuts on the mat.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Pour about two inches of water in a double boiler and heat to simmering.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Chop the chocolate and dump into the top pan of the double boiler. Add the cream.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Melt the chocolate in the double boiler with occasional stirring until smooth and silky.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Pour the melted chocolate over the dates and nuts. Sprinkle the remaining dates and nuts on top of the warm chocolate.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Leave the chocolate to cool and harden.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Slide a spatula under the hardened chocolate to loosen it from the mat.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
With one hand holding one edge of the silicone mat and the other hand holding the spatula, gently lift the hardened mass of chocolate and pull out the mat underneath so that the chocolate now rests on the chopping board.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
You may either break the chocolate bark into irregular pieces (for a rustic look) or cut them into uniform sizes.
4973a300-c6e5-44a9-aae2-65b0e47de1f9
Store the cut chocolate bark in the fridge in a tightly covered container.
2535c13d-6ef1-4188-9932-023b536e84ba
c1dc1e0d-c70e-4a64-a652-bce7ceac43c1
In a food processor or blender, process the frozen strawberries and blueberries until smooth.
c1dc1e0d-c70e-4a64-a652-bce7ceac43c1
Add sugar, as much or as little as your taste buds dictate, and pulse a few more times to blend well.
c1dc1e0d-c70e-4a64-a652-bce7ceac43c1
Drop banana cubes, whole blueberries and cubed strawberries into your ice pop molds.
c1dc1e0d-c70e-4a64-a652-bce7ceac43c1
Pour in the pureed berries slowly to fill the molds almost to the brim.
c1dc1e0d-c70e-4a64-a652-bce7ceac43c1
Position the ice pop mold handles into place.
c1dc1e0d-c70e-4a64-a652-bce7ceac43c1
Freeze until firm.
c1dc1e0d-c70e-4a64-a652-bce7ceac43c1
To loosen the ice pops, run tap water on the bottom and sides of the mold. Pull up the handle and enjoy your double berry banana ice pops!
1dc18ffe-2b2d-47f8-8cf0-271cfdf4de24
cbab2c28-0faa-4e05-a04f-f2379e0d2df5
Using a wire whisk or an electric mixer, whip the cream to stiff peaks.
cbab2c28-0faa-4e05-a04f-f2379e0d2df5
In another bowl, beat the cream cheese until fluffy. Add the powdered sugar little by little and continue beating until fully incorporated.
cbab2c28-0faa-4e05-a04f-f2379e0d2df5
Add about a cup of whipped cream to the cream cheese. Fold. Add the rest of the cream and fold.
cbab2c28-0faa-4e05-a04f-f2379e0d2df5
Take a pan that is at least three inches high. Cut a piece of cling film large enough to line the bottom and sides of the pan, with enough overhang to cover the top of the cake after it has been assembled. Smoothen the cling film to remove air pockets and creases.
cbab2c28-0faa-4e05-a04f-f2379e0d2df5
Line the bottom of the pan with broas. Spread a quarter of the cheese mixture on top of the cookies. Arrange mango slices on top of the cheese mixture then cover with another quarter of the cheese mixture. Sprinkle chocolate, if using. Repeat the layers.
cbab2c28-0faa-4e05-a04f-f2379e0d2df5
Fold both ends of the cling wrap over the cake. Chill in the fridge for at least six hours. You may freeze the icebox cake but note that ice crystals will form if frozen.
cbab2c28-0faa-4e05-a04f-f2379e0d2df5
To serve, peel off the cling film on top of the cake. Holding both ends of the cling film, pull the mango icebox cake out of the pan. Place on a flat surface. Peel off the cling film on the sides of the cake. Use a wide spatula to separate the cake from the cling film at the bottom. Transfer to a serving plate, slice and serve.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Blind bake the crust Preheat the oven to 400F.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Blind bake the crust Make the crust dough (recipe and instructions). Remember to use only one-third of the ingredients, and substitute more butter for the required amount of shortening. Roll the dough to a thickness of one-fourth inch.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Blind bake the crust Spray or brush a six-inch tart pan lightly with oil.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Blind bake the crust Lay the rolled dough (see how) in the tart pan. Press lightly for a snug fit. Cut off any excess (you don't need overhangs for this tart).
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Blind bake the crust Place a piece of aluminum foil over the crust. Spread enough dried beans or lentils, or rice, on the foil to cover the bottom of the crust.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Blind bake the crust Blind bake the crust at 400F for 20 to 30 minutes. Check after 20 minutes and, if still not crisp, bake another five to ten minutes until you get the desired texture.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Blind bake the crust Cool the crust in the pan for a few minutes then carefully remove from the pan. If you used non-stick paper, peel it off. Cool the crust completely on a rack.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Make the custard While the crust bakes, make the custard. In a pan, mix together the sugar, starch, flour, salt, milk and cream. Stir until smooth. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened. Off the heat, stir in the vanilla extract.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Make the custard Pour half of the cooked mixture into the beaten egg yolks, mixing to incorporate.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Make the custard Pour the egg yolk mixture into the pan, stir well, and continue cooking for about 10 minutes, stirring and scraping the bottom constantly, until the mixture is thick.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Make the custard Transfer the custard to a bowl and lay a sheet of cling film directly on the surface to prevent skin from forming. Cool to room temperature then chill in the fridge for a few hours.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Assemble the fruit tart Hull the strawberries and cut into one-fourth inch slices.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Assemble the fruit tart Peel the kiwi and cut into one-fourth inch slices.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Assemble the fruit tart Place the cooled crust on a plate. Pour the cooled custard to about a quarter inch below the brim. Use a small offset spatula to spread the filling evenly.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Assemble the fruit tart Arrange the sliced fruits on top of the custard. You may use the photos of Alex's fruit tart as a guide or you may want to arrange the fruits differently. Just be creative.
dfff8fbd-cf1a-443b-92b8-10fea62aadc1 Serve the fruit tart The fruit tart may be sliced and served immediately after assembly. Or keep in the fridge until needed.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Bake the shells Preheat the oven to 400F.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Bake the shells Line a baking tray or trays with non-stick paper or silicone mat.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Bake the shells Using a spatula, scrape the pâte à choux into a piping bag fitted with a plain tip (large or medium).
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Bake the shells Pipe the dough into a log about three inches long and an inch-and-a-half wide. You may do this with one stroke if using a large tip or with back-and-forth strokes if using a medium tip. Remember to keep the piped dough at least two inches apart because the logs will puff during baking.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Bake the shells Bake the piped dough at 400F for 20 minutes. Lower the heat to 375F and bake for another 10 minutes or until the tops are dry to the touch and the shells make a hollow sound when tapped lightly.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Bake the shells Cool the baked shells on a rack.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Fill the pastry shells Using a small pointed knife, poke two holes on one side of each shell.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Fill the pastry shells Transfer the pastry cream filling to a clean piping bag with a small plain tip attached.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Fill the pastry shells Holding a shell with one hand and the piping bag with the other, press the pastry cream through the holes of the shells just until filled. Do not overfill as the filling will ooze out. Repeat until all the shells have been filled with pastry cream.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Make the ganache Place the chopped or grated chocolate in a shallow bowl.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Make the ganache In a microwaveable bowl, heat the cream in the microwave on HIGH for 30 seconds or just until it starts to simmer.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Make the ganache Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and let sit for 30 seconds to give the chocolate time to get hot. Stir gently but thoroughly until smooth. Note that you may also use the double boiler method for making ganache.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Make the ganache Let the ganache cool for a few minutes to make it a bit thicker.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Glaze the eclairs Holding each filled shell upside-down, dip the top in the ganache then invert on a rack. Repeat until all the filled shells have been glazed.
63113d37-38f5-4c78-a6ba-170cef68ef5d Glaze the eclairs Place the dark chocolate eclairs in a covered container or containers, in a single layer, and chill in the fridge for a few hours (or up to 24 hours) until needed.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
In a bowl, stir together the flour, baking soda and salt.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Beat the cream cheese and butter together until light and fluffy. You can do this by hand but since this cookie dough was made with a stand mixer, the following are instructions for mixing the dough using a stand mixer. Choose the paddle attachment and beat on high for a minute.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Add the brown and white sugars to the cream cheese mixture. Over medium speed, mix until smooth.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Add the egg; mix until fully incorporated.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Set the speed to low. Add the flour mixture slowly. Scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl occasionally.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Dump the chopped Oreo cookies into the dough and fold in using a spatula.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Cover the bowl with cling film and chill the dough for at least two hours.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Preheat the oven to 350F.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Line a cookie pan with non-stick baking paper or a silicone mat.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Using a small ice cream scoop, scrape the chilled cookie dough and release on the prepared pan about two inches apart.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Bake for 18 to 20 minutes. The actual baking time depends on the size of the cookies AND how your oven performs. No two ovens are ever the same. As a guide, after 15 minutes, use a spatula to partially lift one cookie. If the bottom is lightly browned, it should be done. You can bake the cookies a little longer to allow the edges to brown but that is totally optional.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Cool the Oreo cream cheese cookies on the sheet for a few minutes to allow them to firm up a bit. Lift with a spatula and transfer directly to a wire rack. Sprinkle each cookie with a pinch of rock salt. Cool completely.
026c6216-8128-439d-a72c-3db71b0bbf4e
Store the Oreo cream cheese cookies in an airtight container at room temperature. BUT if you live in a region where the humidity goes above 90%, it is a better idea to refrigerate the cookies after 24 hours.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Make the pastry shells. Preheat the oven to 400F.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Line a baking sheet with non-stick paper or a silicone mat.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Spoon the pâte à choux into a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Pipe the pâte à choux on the lined baking sheet into rounds about 1 and 1/2 inches in diameter. Position the rounds at least two inches apart.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Bake the pastry shells at 400F for 20 minutes. Lower the heat to 375F and continue baking for another five to ten minutes, or until the pastry shells are dry to the touch and makes a hollow sound when tapped with the fingertip.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Transfer the pastry shells to a rack to cool.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
While the pastry shells are in the oven, make the custard. In a pan, mix together the sugar, starch-flour mixture, salt, milk and one cup cream. Stir until smooth. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened. Off the heat, stir in the vanilla extract.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Pour half of the flour mixture into the beaten egg yolks, mixing to incorporate.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Pour the egg yolk mixture into the pan, stir well, and continue cooking for about 10 minutes, stirring and scraping the bottom constantly, until the mixture is thick and coats the back of a spoon.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Transfer the custard to a bowl and lay a sheet of cling film directly on the surface to prevent skin from forming. Cool to room temperature then chill in the fridge until needed.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Using a wire whisk or an electric mixer, whip the half cup of chilled cream until soft peaks form.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Make the pastry cream filling. Take the chilled custard out of the fridge and fold in the whipped cream. Spoon the mixture into a piping bag fitted with a small round tip.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Using a small pointed knife, poke a hole on the side of each cooled pastry shell.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Pipe the pastry cream filling into the pastry shell by inserting the round tip into the hole and pressing the piping bag. Do not overfill the pastry shells. You'll know you've overfilled them if the filling oozes out of the hole.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86
Arrange the filling pastry shells on a silicone mat (a rack is an even better idea). Spoon the caramelized sugar over them and leave to set.
498f801e-3c68-4441-b6e4-1c093945db86

Heat the cooking oil in a frying pan or wok to reach a depth of at least three inches. To test if the temperature is correct, drop in a little of the pancake batter. It should float after a few seconds. If it floats too fast, the oil is too hot. If it stays at the bottom for longer than 10 seconds, the oil isn’t hot enough. Adjust the setting of the stove and wait a minute or two for the temperature of the oil to adjust.

Take two large squares of foil and wrap the bottom of a 10-inch springform pan as tightly as you can. You’re going to bake the cheesecake in a water bath and you really don’t want the water to seep into the pan. So, press the foil as closely to the sides of the pan as you can and make sure there are no air pockets where water can enter.
